title: Early morning Flow Crew
description:
Early Morning Flow Crew
Kent is the largest retail building supply chain in Atlantic Canada.  Our mission is to be the best source of home improvement products through superior service, quality products and everyday great prices. We protect our customers and staff by hiring and training associates committed to our safety values.
Responsibilities include:
- Receive product, ship product, and ensure its accuracy. 
- Distribute product to departments.
- Material handling
- Stocking shelves
- Organizing top stock
- Stock pull down
- Operating Power Equipment
- In bay/aisle general maintenance
- Cleaning / dusting
- Price labels
- Use of electronic devices
- Inventory Preparation
- Clearance inventory management
- Flyer/Ad set up
Requirements:
- The ideal candidate is a self-starter and team-oriented individual possessing a strong work ethic. 
- High attention to detail. 
- Individual should be well organized, and able to manage deadlines and priorities. 
- Must be a minimum of 21 years of age due to internal forklift requirements. 
- Heavy lifting is required.
- Early Morning Shift availability.
To Apply for this Career Opportunity:
Please apply online today!

We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

To learn more about our products and services, click here.

Kent Building Supplies is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees.

title: Richmond - Seasonal Tote Repair Crew
location: City of Langley, British Columbia, Canada
description:
Ocean Spray is committed to fostering an inclusive culture, where all individuals thrive as their authentic selves. Our different backgrounds, experiences and ways of thinking inspire us to be exceptional. Be collaborative. Be innovators. We believe that our team members are our best asset and we offer an environment where you can work with passionate and collaborative teams that are motivated to deliver Ocean Spray products around the world.

Ocean Spray of Canada is hiring. We have General Labor positions available on our Tote Repair team at our Richmond Receiving Station.

The positions may include working outdoors, indoors or a combination of both. The hours are typically Monday to Friday, 7 am - 3:30 pm.

During the cranberry harvest (September - November) all positions may be required to work extended hours, including weekends, in order to meet deadlines based on the needs of the business. Overtime is paid after 8 hrs. The start and end times, during harvest will vary on a day-to-day basis.

Start date: March 01, 2021

Positions Available: Tote Repair

Salary: $18.52 per hour

Principal Duties And Responsibilities
  • Utilizing carpentry skills in the process of repairing plywood bins for the cranberry harvest
  • Must be able to lift up to 30 pounds (lbs.) frequently
  • Maintaining a clean work environment
  • Learn and work in a fast-paced production environment
  • Adhere to good manufacturing, safety and environmental practices
  • Work independently or as a part of the team to accomplish work
  • Work inside or outside in various weather conditions
Knowledge, Skill And Ability Requirements
  • Experience with carpentry and tools
  • Forklift certification and experience is an asset
  • Have the ability to work in a team environment, follow instructions, and keep accurate records
  • Prior experience in a food processing facility is an asset
  • Must be willing and available to workday shifts as well as overtime during the harvest season
  • Must be able to communicate effectively, both written and verbally
  • Use of Biometrics for time reporting/clocking in and out is required
  • Must provide and wear steel toed work boots
  • Free parking available on site
  • Must be legally entitled to work in Canada
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

title: Early Morning Flow Crew
location: Corner Brook, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada
description:
Early Morning Flow Crew
Kent is the largest retail building supply chain in Atlantic Canada.  Our mission is to be the best source of home improvement products through superior service, quality products and everyday great prices. We protect our customers and staff by hiring and training associates committed to our safety values.
 
Responsibilities include:
· Receive product, ship product, and ensure its accuracy. 
· Distribute product to departments.
· Material handling
· Stocking shelves
· Organizing top stock
· Stock pull down
· Operating Power Equipment

· Cleaning / dusting
· Price labels
· Use of electronic devices
· Inventory Preparation
· Clearance inventory management
· Flyer/Ad set up

· The ideal candidate is a self-starter and team-oriented individual possessing a strong work ethic. 
· High attention to detail. 
· Individual should be well organized, and able to manage deadlines and priorities. 
· Must be a minimum of 21 years of age due to internal forklift requirements. 
· Heavy lifting is required.
· Early Morning Shift availability.

Please apply online today!

title: Part-time Crew Member
description:
Your vibe and experience

While previous experience working in food service or retail as a barista, server, sales associate, cashier, team member, or customer sales representative is always helpful and appreciated, what is most important is who you are.

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You find joy in the details and believe good quality is what keeps guests coming back. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You understand there is no “I” in team and thrive in social situations. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You get that service isn’t a transaction, it’s about connection. That a smile can make all the difference in someone’s day. It’s genuine, and it’s who you are.


The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

  • Greeting guests, taking orders and processing payments
  • Preparing food and drinks
  • Managing delivery and mobile orders
  • Assembling orders and packaging take-out and delivery
  • Keeping all surfaces clean and sanitary to ensure the safety for our guests, fellow crew members, and yourself

Whether you are working in the kitchen, at the Drive-Thru, or at the front counter you are a part of a dynamic team that works together to deliver an exceptional guest experience.


Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

  • Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further
  • A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks
  • Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs
  • A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace
  • Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

Additional Information

About us 

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request

title: Équipier à temps partiel / Part-time Crew Member
description:
Informations complémentaires

À notre sujet

En 1954, après avoir découvert un petit restaurant de hamburgers en Californie, un représentant audacieux du nom de Ray Kroc allait rédiger la toute première page de l’histoire de McDonald’s®. En 1967, le premier restaurant McDonald’s du Canada ouvre ses portes à Richmond, en Colombie-Britannique. Depuis ce jour, nous évoluons au rythme de nos collectivités et offrons des aliments de qualité à un excellent rapport qualité-prix. Aujourd’hui, McDonald’s du Canada est fière de se classer parmi les chefs de file mondiaux de la restauration, offrant des postes en restaurants de compagnie ou détenus par des franchisés indépendants.

title: Early morning stocking crew
description:
Store - VAN-PORT COQUITLAM, BC

We're here for the Makers! Come be a part of the team where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Michaels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are here for all Team Members and all Makers to create, innovate and be better together.

To review a comprehensive list of benefits, please visit Michaels Benefits

Complete truck unload and merchandise duties throughout the store. Help customers shop and find what they are looking for. Deliver friendly customer service.

Major Activities

  • Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and Company programs to ensure compliance to applicable laws and requirements; execute Company policies and standards
  • Participate in truck un-load and stocking processes to ensure truck standards are followed and completed within budget
  • Participate in the planogram process (POG’s) in both SBA and seasonal to ensure they are complete timely and accurately
  • Participate in the AD set process on scheduled Sundays
  • Adhere to visual merchandising standards to ensure delivery of our brand promise to the customer
  • Merchandise recovery and go-backs
  • Help maintain seasonal sets and the feature space to our visual merchandising standards on a daily and weekly basis
  • Provide a well merchandised and in-stock store for the customer to shop
  • Acknowledge customers, help locate product and provide solutions
  • Interacts with others in an accepting and respectful manner; remains positive and respectful, even in difficult situations; promotes commitment to the organization’s vision and values; projects a positive image and serves as a role model for others
  • Support shrink and safety programs
  • Perform Store In Stock Optimization (SISO) duties as assigned
  • Operate cash register and line busting as assigned
  • Assist with Omni channel processes
  • Enroll customers in the Rewards program

Other Duties As Assigned

Preferred Type of experience the job requires

  • Retail merchandising and customer service experience preferred

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to remain standing for long periods of time
  • Ability to move throughout the store
  • Regular bending, lifting, carrying, reaching and stretching
  • Lifting heavy boxes and accessing high shelves by ladder or similar equipment
  • If you need help performing these functions of your job, please contact supervisor so that we may engage in the interactive process with you and find a reasonable accommodation

Work Environment

  • Public retail store setting taking care of our customers; all public areas are climate controlled; some stock rooms may not be climate controlled; some outdoor work if assigned to retrieve shopping carts or while unloading trucks; Frame shop contains glass cutter and heat press; work hours include nights, weekends and early mornings

Applicants in Canada must satisfy federal, provincial, and local legal requirements of the job.

title: Crew Boss / Planting Crew Chief - Northern NB
description:
CREW BOSS / PLANTING CREW CHIEF

NORTHERN NB

SEASONAL (END OF APRIL TO OCTOBER)

STUDENT (END OF APRIL TO AUGUST)

Why You Should Choose This Job
  • Daily challenges
  • Competitive and uniform compensation of +/- 850$ / week
  • Production/quality bonus - potentially earn up to an additional $200 or $350 per week
  • Possibilities of accommodation
  • Safe workplace
  • Outdoor working environment
  • Student job (if applicable):
    • Opportunity for internal promotion and full-time careers after graduation
The Opportunity

The Northern NB Woodlands Division is seeking to fill Crew Boss / Plantation Crew Chiefs position for the 2022 planting season. We are looking for reliable and motivated individuals who demonstrate a positive attitude towards teamwork.
  • Responsible for the health & safety of a group of 10-15 tree planters and support staff
  • Constantly working to improve their jobsites and dealing with any conflicts within their work group
  • Leading and documenting mandatory stretching
  • Meeting or exceeding quality and production targets
  • Transporting workers to and from work sites
  • Accurate and timely Payroll entry
  • Perform quality check on a daily basis
Your Qualifications
  • Leadership skills or experience in team management
  • Be able to motivate youself to work independently without supervision
  • Positive attitude and ability to motivate peers
  • Ability to analyze and solve problems
  • Work in a team and in a safe manner
  • Having a valid driver's licence (class 5)
  • Bilingualism (asset)
  • Meet the JDI selection criteria
To Apply For This Opportunity

Please apply online.

Thanks for your interest in our company!

J.D. Irving, Limited - Division forestière est attaché au principe de l'égalité des chances dans ses pratiques d'emploi et s'engage à fournir un environnement exempt de discrimination et de harcèlement pour tous les employés.

Additional Information
  • Posting Date: Oct 29, 2021

title: Membre d'équipe du réapprovisionnement
description:
Store - MON-VAUDREUIL, QC

We're here for the Makers! Come be a part of the team where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Michaels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are here for all Team Members and all Makers to create, innovate and be better together.

To review a comprehensive list of benefits, please visit Michaels Benefits

Complete truck unload and merchandise duties throughout the store. Help customers shop and find what they are looking for. Deliver friendly customer service.

Major Activities

  • Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and Company programs to ensure compliance to applicable laws and requirements; execute Company policies and standards
  • Participate in truck un-load and stocking processes to ensure truck standards are followed and completed within budget
  • Participate in the planogram process (POG’s) in both SBA and seasonal to ensure they are complete timely and accurately
  • Participate in the AD set process on scheduled Sundays
  • Adhere to visual merchandising standards to ensure delivery of our brand promise to the customer
  • Merchandise recovery and go-backs
  • Help maintain seasonal sets and the feature space to our visual merchandising standards on a daily and weekly basis
  • Provide a well merchandised and in-stock store for the customer to shop
  • Acknowledge customers, help locate product and provide solutions
  • Interacts with others in an accepting and respectful manner; remains positive and respectful, even in difficult situations; promotes commitment to the organization’s vision and values; projects a positive image and serves as a role model for others
  • Support shrink and safety programs
  • Perform Store In Stock Optimization (SISO) duties as assigned
  • Operate cash register and line busting as assigned
  • Assist with Omni channel processes
  • Enroll customers in the Rewards program

Other Duties As Assigned

Preferred Type of experience the job requires

  • Retail merchandising and customer service experience preferred

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to remain standing for long periods of time
  • Ability to move throughout the store
  • Regular bending, lifting, carrying, reaching and stretching
  • Lifting heavy boxes and accessing high shelves by ladder or similar equipment
  • If you need help performing these functions of your job, please contact supervisor so that we may engage in the interactive process with you and find a reasonable accommodation

Work Environment

  • Public retail store setting taking care of our customers; all public areas are climate controlled; some stock rooms may not be climate controlled; some outdoor work if assigned to retrieve shopping carts or while unloading trucks; Frame shop contains glass cutter and heat press; work hours include nights, weekends and early mornings

Applicants in Canada must satisfy federal, provincial, and local legal requirements of the job.

title: Manoeuvre (Équipe de réserve)
description:
Chez Résolu, nous formons un groupe d’employés aux compétences très variées. Nous croyons que de vous donner les moyens de vous réaliser pleinement et sans contrainte est la clé de notre succès commun.

Notre établissement de Clermont (Québec, Canada) est actuellement à la recherche de candidats compétents en vue de pourvoir le poste de Manoeuvre (Équipe de réserve). Il s’agit d’un poste permanent à temps plein. La date d’entrée en fonction souhaitée est le 2021-11-12.

Vous serez affecté aux différents départements de production ou toutes autres tâches requises par les opérations.

Votre Profil Pour L'usine De Clermont
  • Le candidat doit démontrer que la sécurité est une valeur;
  • Souci du travail bien fait;
  • Polyvalence;
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe;
  • Ponctuel, disponible et responsable;
  • Capacité d'adaptation à un horaire varié (jour, soir, nuit, fin de semaine);
  • Le candidat doit détenir un diplôme d'études secondaires ou une équivalence (DEP pâtes et papier un atout)
  • Le candidat détenant un diplôme d'études secondaires (DES) formation générale ou toutes autres combinaisons de diplômes et d'expérience pourra être considéré;
  • Une expérience de travail en milieu industriel est un atout.
  • Salaire à discuter selon expérience
  • Pour postuler cliquez ce lien pour accéder à l'offre : https://career4.successfactors.com/career?career%5fns=job%5flisting&company=C0000179750P&navBarLevel=JOB%5fSEARCH&rcm%5fsite%5flocale=fr%5fCA&career_job_req_id=713&selected_lang=fr_CA&jobAlertController_jobAlertId=&jobAlertController_jobAlertName=&browserTimeZone=America/Toronto&_s.crb=YOBWkK55tU7paoC3uh4ewIlkHDta23hApzK1PlfZaWM%3d
Nous communiquerons seulement avec les candidats retenus.

Produits forestiers Résolu souscrit aux principes de l'égalit

Faites partie du changement. Joignez-vous à une équipe dynamique.

Chef de file mondial de l’industrie des produits forestiers, Résolu vous propose un milieu de travail énergique et sécuritaire, riche en occasions et en défis qui vous permettront de développer vos compétences. Nous sommes plus de 8000 employés en poste au Canada, aux États-Unis et dans plusieurs autres pays du monde.

Nous recherchons des personnes possédant l’expérience et le savoir-faire nécessaires pour améliorer notre efficacité, accroître notre rentabilité à long terme et fournir à nos clients des produits et services de premier ordre. Et vous, que recherchez-vous?

Notre entreprise est en train d’écrire une nouvelle page de son histoire au sein d’un secteur en évolution rapide. Nous avons réalisé d’importants progrès pour assurer notre viabilité et devenir un fournisseur de choix, respectueux de l’environnement. Venez participer à notre histoire et faire partie du changement!

Pour savoir comment nous bâtissons le Résolu de demain, consultez notre rapport annuel sur

Joignez-vous à la conversation!

Lisez Le blogue Résolu à

title: Clerk Grocery Night Crew- EN
description:
Requisition ID: 70384

Career Group: Store Careers

Job Category: BC Store Operations

Travel Requirements

Country: Canada (CA)

Province: British Columbia (CA-BC)

City: North vancouver

Location: 4958 Parkgate Village Safeway

Postal Code

Safeway grocery stores provide an exceptional food shopping experience to consumers from Vancouver, British Columbia to Thunder Bay, Ontario. We are the newest member of Sobeys Inc.’s retail food offering which serves the needs of Canadians with more than 1,500 stores in over 800 communities from coast-to-coast. Whether it's your first job or you're ready for a new challenge, we have a career to fit your life. Our commitment to delivering top quality products and superior service to our customers, and for giving back to the communities we serve has earned us a reputation as an employer of choice for those looking for an exciting career in food retail.

Overview

The Grocery Clerk is responsible for carrying out the full range of duties of the position in a professional, responsible, accurate and timely fashion. The Clerk will deliver exceptional customer service, foster customer loyalty, fulfill customer needs and actively contribute to an environment of employee and customer engagement.

Job Description
  • Adhere to all Food Safety Protocols, Standard Operating Procedures, Health and Safety, corporate policies, and other programs and initiatives
  • Provide customer service to meet customer needs
  • Keep work area clean and presentable
  • Process Grocery orders
  • Perform program execution and merchandising of product
  • Perform retail floor maintenance
  • Maintain back shop
  • Receive warehouse orders
  • Increase store sales by actively promoting products
  • Participate in the training of junior staff
  • Order and receive stock in accordance with company inventory control procedures as required
  • Process department shrink
  • Maintain a clean and safe working environment as per Company requirements
  • Other duties as required
Ontario Only
  • Additional duties for receiving shifts (as authorized and scheduled by management
  • Receive, unload and verify load and bill of lading against truck schedule for all incoming product
  • Tag and mark each pallet and complete receiving paperwork as assigned (shrink reports, claims)
  • Compare packing slips to goods and key product information into SAP system
  • Ensure equipment is in good working order by reporting any unsafe equipment or conditions
  • Provide internal customer service by effectively communicating with store management / staff and providing updates on shipments as requested
Job Requirements
  • Ability to work independently in a fast paced environment
While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.

We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.

title: Équipier à temps partiel / Part-time Crew Member (New)
description:
Notre offre

Travailler avec nous signifie que vous aurez l’occasion d’apprendre en travaillant, d’avoir un horaire flexible et de travailler dans un environnement sécuritaire et inclusif. Ce que cela signifie en pratique :

·       Accès à des occasions de formation et de perfectionnement de vos compétences qui vous feront progresser

·       Rémunération globale comprenant des rabais, des programmes de motivation et des avantages en reconnaissance de votre travail

·       Heures et horaire flexibles qui conviennent à vos besoins, dans les collectivités partout au Canada

·       Milieu de travail sécuritaire, respectueux et inclusif

·       Possibilité d’exprimer votre authenticité au travail – bienvenue aux personnes de tout âge, de tout horizon et de toute culture – tout comme les clients qui fréquentent nos restaurants chaque jour.
 

Le poste

Nous sommes certains que vous avez une idée de ce que c’est que de travailler avec nous, mais au cas où, voici quelques grandes lignes sur le poste :

  • Accueillir les clients, prendre les commandes et traiter les paiements en argent comptant et par carte
  • Préparer les aliments et les boissons
  • Gérer les commandes mobiles et de livraison
  • Assembler les commandes et emballer les commandes pour emporter et pour la livraison
  • Garder toutes les surfaces propres et assainies afin d’assurer la sécurité de nos clients et de vos collègues équipiers

Que vous travailliez dans la cuisine, au service-au-volant ou au comptoir, vous faites partie d’une équipe dynamique qui travaille ensemble pour offrir une expérience-client exceptionnelle.

 _______________________________________________________________________

Our offer

Working with us means that you will have the opportunity to earn and learn, flexibility, and a safe and inclusive work environment. What this means in practice is:

·       Access to education and skills development opportunities that take you further

·       A total rewards package that includes discounts, incentives, and recognition perks

·       Flexible hours/shifts that suit your needs

·       A safe, respectful and inclusive workplace

·       Bring your authentic self to work – welcoming people of every age, background, and culture – just like the guests who visit our restaurants every day

The job

We are sure that you have an idea about what working with us is like, but just in case here are some of the highlights on what your job will entail:

  • Greeting guests, taking orders and processing payments
  • Preparing food and drinks
  • Managing delivery and mobile orders
  • Assembling orders and packaging take-out and delivery
  • Keeping all surfaces clean and sanitary to ensure the safety for our guests, fellow crew members, and yourself

 

Whether you are working in the kitchen, at the Drive-Thru, or at the front counter you are a part of a dynamic team that works together to deliver an exceptional guest experience.



Qualifications

Votre énergie et expérience

Bien que votre expérience de travail antérieure dans l’industrie de la restauration ou du commerce de détail en tant que barista, serveur, associé aux ventes, préposé à la caisse, membre d’une équipe ou représentant des ventes soit toujours utile et appréciée, ce qui compte le plus, c’est qui vous êtes.

Vous êtes digne de confiance et vous avez confiance en ceux qui vous entourent. Vous avez le souci du détail et vous savez que c’est la qualité qui fait revenir les clients. Vous savez garder votre calme et votre sang-froid dans un environnement très dynamique. Vous comprenez qu’il faut mettre son ego de côté en équipe et vous vous épanouissez dans les activités sociales. Vous êtes toujours prêt à apprendre et à vous perfectionner. Vous comprenez que le service ce n’est pas qu’une simple transaction, mais une question de connexion. Vous savez qu’un sourire peut faire toute la différence dans la journée d’un client. Votre sourire est authentique. Il vous définit.

_________________________________________________________________________

Your vibe and experience

While previous experience working in food service or retail as a barista, server, sales associate, cashier, team member, or customer sales representative is always helpful and appreciated, what is most important is who you are.

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You find joy in the details and believe good quality is what keeps guests coming back. You remain cool, calm and collected in a fast-paced environment. You understand there is no “I” in team and thrive in social situations. You’re always willing to learn and grow. You get that service isn’t a transaction, it’s about connection. That a smile can make all the difference in someone’s day. It’s genuine, and it’s who you are.

 



Informations complémentaires

À notre sujet

En 1954, Ray Kroc, un entrepreneur-vendeur, découvrait un petit restaurant de hamburgers en Californie et écrivait la première page de l’histoire de McDonald’s®. En 1967, le premier restaurant McDonald’s du Canada ouvre ses portes à Richmond, en Colombie-Britannique. Depuis ce jour, nous avons évolué au rythme de nos collectivités et servons des aliments de qualité offrant un excellent rapport qualité-prix. Aujourd’hui, McDonald’s du Canada est fière de se classer parmi les chefs de file des services alimentaires dans le monde, et d’offrir des possibilités d’emploi dans des restaurants appartenant à la compagnie ou détenus par des franchisés indépendants.

Qui plus est, nous continuons d’appliquer avec conviction notre politique de longue date selon laquelle tous les employés et tous les candidats ont un accès égal et équitable aux différentes occasions. Si votre candidature est retenue dans le cadre du processus de sélection et si vous avez besoin d’accommodement, nous vous trouverons ou fournirons un accommodement convenable de façon à prendre en compte vos besoins en raison d’une limitation.  

________________________________________________________________________

About us

In 1954, an enterprising salesman named Ray Kroc discovered a small burger restaurant in California, and wrote the first page of McDonald’s history. In 1967, the first McDonald’s Canada opened in Richmond, B.C. and we’ve been growing with our communities and serving quality food at great a value ever since. Today, McDonald’s Canada is proud to be one of the world’s leading foodservice retailers, offering job opportunities at corporate-owned restaurants or restaurants owned by independent franchisees.

 

McDonald’s Canada and Owner/Operators are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace for all. Our workplaces have a long-standing policy of providing fair, equitable, and accessible opportunities for all employees and prospective employees. Accommodations during the application process are available upon request.

What this means in practice is:', 'Whether you are working in the kitchen, at the Drive-Thru, or at the front counter you are a part of a dynamic team that works together to deliver an exceptional guest experience.']

title: Équipier à temps plein / Full-time Crew Member
description:
Que diriez-vous d’avoir un horaire flexible qui vous laisse assez de temps pour faire vos affaires, petites ou grandes? Que diriez-vous de pouvoir grandir professionnellement, personnellement et financièrement? Que diriez-vous d’avoir la chance de faire partie d’une entreprise dirigée par des propriétaires indépendants, qui est active dans votre collectivité et qui a aidé plus de 300 000 familles canadiennes d’enfant malade par l’entremise des Manoirs Ronald McDonald? Si tout cela vous parle, nous aimerions vous rencontrer.

VOTRE PERSONNALITÉ

Vous êtes digne de confiance et faites confiance aux autres. Vous trouvez votre bonheur dans les détails et pensez que c’est la qualité qui fait revenir les clients avant tout. Lors de situations stressantes, vous êtes cool, vous gardez votre sang-froid. Vous savez jouer en équipe et êtes une personne sociable. Vous avez compris que le service n’est pas une transaction, que c’est plutôt le moment de créer des liens avec les gens. Vous êtes d’avis qu’un sourire peut illuminer la journée de quelqu’un. Pour vous, tout ça va de soi, c’est vous tout craché.

OFFRE D’EMPLOI :

  • Satisfait les gens sur tous les fronts : accueil, prise de commande et les McFringales.
  • Prépare la nourriture et s’assure que nos célèbres hamburgers et nos célèbres frites… demeurent célèbres.
  • Traite les paiements.  Travaille à la caisse, travaille son sourire.
  • Emballe les commandes pour emporter. Mais résiste à la tentation de prendre une frite au passage… (on sait que tout le monde les adore!)
  • Gère les réfrigérateurs. Oui, c’est remplir les frigos, mais c’est vraiment important quand on sert le hamburger le plus populaire au monde.

______________________________________________________________________________________

How about flexible hours that let you do your thing, whatever your thing is. The opportunity to grow. Professionally, personally and financially. How about the chance to be part of a company that’s primarily run by independent business owners and that’s active in your community. That’s helped more than 300,000 Canadian families with sick kids through Ronald McDonald House. If that sounds good to you, then we’d love to hear from you.

YOUR VIBE

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You find joy in the details and believe good quality is what keeps guests coming back. You remain cool, calm and collected under pressure. You understand there is no “I” in team and thrive in social situations. You get that service isn’t a transaction. It’s about connection. That a smile can make all the difference in someone’s day. It’s genuine, and it’s who you are.

YOUR JOB

  • Making people’s day on all fronts: Greeting people, taking orders and satisfying McCravings.
  • Preparing food and keeping our world famous burgers and fries, world famous.
  • Processing payments.  Working cash, working your smile.
  • Package take-out food. But no sneaking fries…we know they’re everybody’s favourite!
  • Fridge management. Okay, it’s stocking the fridge, but it’s really important when you serve the world’s most popular burger.

Qualifications

Disponible  06h00 à 23 h00 à temps plein du Lundi au Vendredi . 



Informations complémentaires

À notre sujet

En 1954, après avoir découvert un petit restaurant de hamburgers en Californie, un représentant audacieux du nom de Ray Kroc allait rédiger la toute première page de l’histoire de McDonald’s®. En 1967, le premier restaurant McDonald’s du Canada ouvre ses portes à Richmond, en Colombie-Britannique. Depuis ce jour, nous évoluons au rythme de nos collectivités et offrons des aliments de qualité à un excellent rapport qualité-prix. Aujourd’hui, McDonald’s du Canada est fière de se classer parmi les chefs de file mondiaux de la restauration, offrant des postes en restaurants de compagnie ou détenus par des franchisés indépendants.

How about the chance to be part of a company that’s primarily run by independent business owners and that’s active in your community. If that sounds good to you, then we’d love to hear from you.', 'Traite les paiements.\xa0 Travaille à la caisse, travaille son sourire.', 'Disponible\xa0 06h00\xa0à 23 h00\xa0à temps plein du Lundi au Vendredi .', 'Prépare la nourriture et s’assure que nos célèbres hamburgers et nos célèbres frites… demeurent célèbres.']

title: Asphalt Paving Personnel Crew
description:
Why work for Lafarge?

As the global leader in innovative and sustainable building materials, we’re committed to shaping a greener, smarter and healthier world. At Lafarge Canada Inc., safety comes first, collaboration matters and diversity is celebrated with people who share our desire to continually make our materials better.

Do you have the drive, the skills, and the passion to join us?

Overview

Lafarge Construction is currently looking for people to join our team for Asphalt Paving Personnel. Scope of work will be in our asphalt division. Successful candidates should be hardworking, self- motivated and enthusiastic team players, willing and ready to work with all personalities.

To apply, send your resume to: daniel.white2@lafargeholcim.com Please reference the Job Title you are applying for in your e-mail.

Postions Avaliable

 Responsibilities
  • skid steers
  • rollers
  • milling machines
  • pavers
  • screed
Qualifications
  • Class 5 license and own means of transportation is required.
  • No experience necessary, but will greatly increase you chances for being a successful candidate.
  • Able to work long hours and weekends.
  • Ability to work with a group or alone.
  • Able to follow all safety requirements.
Working for Lafarge offers a wide variety of career opportunities that utilize your abilities and skills to contribute to a better world. In addition to local and global developmental opportunities, we provide employees with competitive compensation, a comprehensive benefits plan, a health & wellness program with financial incentives, an extensive global e-learning platform and much more! More information can be found at: www.lafarge.ca

As part of our dedicated focus on the health and safety of all employees, a pre-employment medical, including drug and alcohol testing and a criminal record check, may be required.

LafargeHolcim

As we are reinventing the way the world builds, we need world-class talent to join our Lafarge Canada team: people who are passionate, driven by curiosity and keen to grow, learn, develop and thrive in our high-performance culture.

Whatever you do, you will make a difference here. Because we know that your passion and curiosity are the natural resources the world needs.

See more opportunities at www.lafarge.ca/careers .

We thank you for your interest. Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. Lafarge is committed to the principles of employment equity and encourages the applications from women, visible minorities, and persons with disabilities.

title: Crew Training Manager
description:
IWC Excavation Ltd is a specialized Civil and General Contractor based out of Nanaimo, BC. With a team of over 100 employees and more than 50 pieces of heavy equipment, which are maintained in our own maintenance facility, IWC can execute on small and large scale projects across the province.

At IWCE we know that it is our people that make us special and allow us to get results that count. We are proud of what we do and are motivated by leading with a culture of excellence, safety, quality, and teamwork.

Currently, we are looking to add a Crew Training Manager to our team. This position will involve working with all new hires and current employees, to ensure their level of training is adequate for the duties they will be performing.

Required Qualifications, Experience, and Attributes:

  • Minimum of 5 years in a Civil Supervisory role
  • Full understanding of heavy equipment operation
  • Knowledgeable in all aspects of Civil Construction including:
  • Small tools operation
  • Pipe Laying
  • Cut/Fill/Grade
  • Infrastructure
  • Road building
  • Sub-divisions
  • Patient demeanor
  • Excellent leadership qualities
  • Positive and safety oriented attitude

We welcome applications from all individuals who meet the above criteria and who are interested in an exciting career with IWC Excavation Ltd. If you would like to learn more about IWC and other exciting opportunities, please visit our website at www.iwce.ca.

 

  • Excavation offers competitive wages, full benefits package, including dental & vision and RRSP matching program

title: Membre d'équipe du réapprovisionnement
description:
Store - GREENFIELD PARK, QC

We're here for the Makers! Come be a part of the team where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!

Michaels is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are here for all Team Members and all Makers to create, innovate and be better together.

To review a comprehensive list of benefits, please visit Michaels Benefits

Complete truck unload and merchandise duties throughout the store. Help customers shop and find what they are looking for. Deliver friendly customer service.

Major Activities

  • Adhere to Standard Operating Procedures (SOP’s) and Company programs to ensure compliance to applicable laws and requirements; execute Company policies and standards
  • Participate in truck un-load and stocking processes to ensure truck standards are followed and completed within budget
  • Participate in the planogram process (POG’s) in both SBA and seasonal to ensure they are complete timely and accurately
  • Participate in the AD set process on scheduled Sundays
  • Adhere to visual merchandising standards to ensure delivery of our brand promise to the customer
  • Merchandise recovery and go-backs
  • Help maintain seasonal sets and the feature space to our visual merchandising standards on a daily and weekly basis
  • Provide a well merchandised and in-stock store for the customer to shop
  • Acknowledge customers, help locate product and provide solutions
  • Interacts with others in an accepting and respectful manner; remains positive and respectful, even in difficult situations; promotes commitment to the organization’s vision and values; projects a positive image and serves as a role model for others
  • Support shrink and safety programs
  • Perform Store In Stock Optimization (SISO) duties as assigned
  • Operate cash register and line busting as assigned
  • Assist with Omni channel processes
  • Enroll customers in the Rewards program

Other Duties As Assigned

Preferred Type of experience the job requires

  • Retail merchandising and customer service experience preferred

Physical Requirements

  • Ability to remain standing for long periods of time
  • Ability to move throughout the store
  • Regular bending, lifting, carrying, reaching and stretching
  • Lifting heavy boxes and accessing high shelves by ladder or similar equipment
  • If you need help performing these functions of your job, please contact supervisor so that we may engage in the interactive process with you and find a reasonable accommodation

Work Environment

  • Public retail store setting taking care of our customers; all public areas are climate controlled; some stock rooms may not be climate controlled; some outdoor work if assigned to retrieve shopping carts or while unloading trucks; Frame shop contains glass cutter and heat press; work hours include nights, weekends and early mornings

Applicants in Canada must satisfy federal, provincial, and local legal requirements of the job.

title: Director, Crew Resources
description:
Join us in making vacation dreams come true!

About Us

Sunwing Travel Group is the largest vertically integrated travel group in North America and during this unprecedented time, we are continuing to search for top talent. We are looking for candidates who are EPIC (entrepreneurial, passionate, innovative, and customer-centric) to join our team and help deliver our purpose “passionate people making vacation dreams come true”.

We want to continue to do our part to help end this pandemic, protect our employees and those vacationing with us, and to support the travel industry’s full recovery. Sunwing requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for our new and existing employees. We will make accommodations for qualifying medical or religious exemptions.

To learn more about our vaccination policy, follow this link: https://bit.ly/2X4TOOk

Also, learn more about our Safe with Sunwing commitment and how Sunwing is keeping its employees and customers safe here: https://bit.ly/3ngVrne

The Opportunity!

As the Director, Crew Resources you will lead a team in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment with minimal oversight. Adapting your time and workflow to the most pressing issues at hand will be essential. You have the ability to multi-task and take on or develop new projects or initiatives on your own accord. You are very good at working closely with inter-department groups or specifically with the pilots and cabin crew in Flight Operations. Your communication skills are excellent. With sometimes very little advanced warning, you can meet the demands of sometimes long work hours, weekends, and travel abroad as required. You will report directly to the Vice President, Flight Operations.

What You’ll Be a Part Of!
  • Remote and Hybrid Work Opportunities
  • Grow your career with challenging and rewarding work that makes a difference
  • Opportunity to give back through our social responsibility initiatives
  • Work with a fun, passionate, travel-loving team!
  • Great travel perks!
  • Free Parking
  • Open concept, collaborative workspace
  • See for yourself! @sunwinglife
What You’ll Do
  • Ensure safety is the primary objective by adhering to the Sunwing safety policy and utilizing the appropriate safety reporting program in order to identify and communicate all known hazards and risks to the organization.
  • Achieve optimum schedule efficiency while ensuring crews are planned and scheduled using UNIFOR and CUPE Collective Agreements whilst complying with Transport Canada Regulations.
  • Communicating and liaising with Commercial Planning & Scheduling to address crewing requirements and cost issues related to the master flight schedule.
  • Plan and monitor all flights, duty time limitations and rest periods. Review and approve final blocks.
  • Oversight of long and short-term crew planning and forecasting.
  • Oversee financial and operational results by, reviewing monthly schedules and providing reports, for continual analysis of efficiencies and cost reduction.
  • Liaise with the tour operator regarding cost-effective planning for the master flight schedule.
  • Prepare the annual budget for Crew Scheduling & Crew Planning. Assist in the preparation of the annual budget for pilots, flight attendants and crew movements (hotel, positioning and per diem).
  • Liaise with Finance and provide information regarding per diem records, crew payroll adjustments and other crew-related items.
  • Oversight of the Crew Planning, Crew Scheduling and Crew Travel Departments to ensure they execute their duties with a positive and supportive approach when interacting with the pilots and flight attendants.
  • Oversight of the department employee time and attendance.
  • Ensuring continual improvement through the periodic review of documented policies, processes, and procedures.
  • Performing analysis of labour contracts.
  • Assisting in business cases and cost analyses for various projects in Flight Operations.
  • Conducting benchmarking or other studies as required.
  • Conducting audits or assisting with audits in coordination with Flight Operations QA and the Safety Department.
  • Assuming any additional responsibilities as delegated by the Vice President, Flight Operations.
What You’ll Need
  • Have at least five (5) to seven (7) years of aviation management experience, preferably in a role within flight operations management with a Part 705 (or equivalent) airline.
  • Expert knowledge of Canadian Aviation Regulations (CARs), Federal Aviation Administration Regulations (FARs), European Aviation Safety Agency Third Country Operators (EASA TCO), plus any other operational jurisdictions.
  • Have strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Have demonstrated capability for managing complex problems in a dynamic aviation environment.
  • Project management experience is an asset.
  • A proven track record of working constructively with a variety of airline stakeholders.
We thank all who apply however only those who meet the qualifications will be contacted.

At Sunwing, diversity is important to us, follow this link: https://bit.ly/3DYzBel to learn about how Diversity and Inclusion has always been, and continues to be, a top priority for us. We are proud that our workforce is made up of passionate people from all experiences and backgrounds. We are also committed to employment equity and to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. We welcome applications from everyone. We will accommodate all applicants throughout the hiring process. If you are an individual who requires accommodation to apply to this position, please email [email protected]

title: Crew boss / Superviseur d'équipe de plantation - Nord du N-.B.
description:
CREW BOSS / SUPERVISEUR D'ÉQUIPE DE PLANTATION
NORD DU N.-B.

SAISONNIER (FIN AVRIL A OCTOBRE)
OU ÉTUDIANT (FIN AVRIL A AOUT)


Pourquoi choisir cet emploi:
- D éfis quotidiens
- Salaires compétitifs et uniformes, en moyenne +/- 850$ / semaine
- Bonis de production/qualité - pouvant aller de 200$ à 350$ / semaine
- Possibilité d'accommodation
- Lieu de travail sécuritaire
- Emplois étudiant (si applicable):- Opportunité de promotion interne pour des rôles d’étudiant (stage et été) et des carrières à temps plein après l’obtention du diplôme


Le travail:
La Division des Opérations forestières du Nord du Nouveau-Brunswick cherche à pourvoir des postes de Crew boss / Superviseur d'équipe de plantation pour la saison de plantation 2022. Nous recherchons des personnes fiables et motivées qui démontrent une attitude positive à l’égard du travail en équipe.
- Responsable de la santé & sécurité d'un groupe de 10 à 15 planteurs d'arbres et autres personnels de soutien
- Gestion du personnel et gestion de conflits
- Diriger et documenter les étirements obligatoires
- Atteindre ou surpasser les objectifs de qualité et de production
- Transporter les travailleurs aux sites de travail
- Gestion de la paie
- S'assurer de l'amélioration du travail
- Assurer un contrôle de qualité quotidien

Vos qualifications:
- Habileté de leadership ou expérience en gestion d'équipe
- Ëtre en mesure de pouvoir se motiver pour travailler de manière autonome sans supervision
- Attitude positive et capacité à motiver ses pairs
- Capacité d'analyse et résolution de problème
- Ëtre en mesure de travailler en équipe et de façon sécuritaire
- Permis de conduire valide (classe 5)
- Bilinguisme considéré comme un atout
- Rencontrer les critères de sélection de JDI

La Compagnie:
Fondée en 1882, J.D. Irving, Limited (JDI) exerce ses activités dans l’est du Canada (Nouveau-Brunswick, Nouvelle-Écosse, Ile-du-Prince-Édouard, Québec, Ontario, Terre-Neuve et Labrador), ainsi qu’aux États-Unis. Nous sommes une équipe de 15 000 employés dévoués.
Chez J.D. Irving, Limited, vous faites partie d’une équipe dynamique de professionnels qui mènent avec intégrité et sont passionnés par l’obtention de résultats. Grâce à une culture qui favorise le talent et crée un lieu de travail inclusif, vous pouvez développer votre carrière dans nos diverses divisions opérationnelles.


Pour postuler pour cette possibilité de carrière :
Veuillez poser candidature en ligne.

À quoi vous attendre
Toutes les candidatures seront examinées par l'un de nos recruteurs. Si le recruteur voit une opportunité potentielle (actuelle ou future) correspondant à vos compétences et à votre expérience, vous serez contacté pour discuter de vos qualifications, du lieu de travail souhaité et de votre intégration dans le groupe d'entreprises JDI.
* Seuls les candidats possédant les qualifications nécessaires seront contactés.

Nous vous remercions de votre intérêt pour notre entreprise!



J.D. Irving, Limited - Division forestière est attaché au principe de l'égalité des chances dans ses pratiques d'emploi et s'engage à fournir un environnement exempt de discrimination et de harcèlement pour tous les employés.

title: Window Installer Crew - Subcontractor
description:
Renewal by Andersen, America's premier replacement window and door company, is seeking highly skilled window and door installation subcontractors. If you have a crew of at least two and a proven track record of superior workmanship, we would like to talk to you.

Our homeowners value integrity, quality and expect exceptional results. We are the leader in the industry and are looking for the best to work with us on our continued growth!

WHAT YOU BRING | THE PERSON
  • A minimum of 4 years of window installation OR construction remodeling experience, preferred
  • A proven track record of superior workmanship
  • A strong focus on customer service
  • Self-motivation and results orientation
  • Time and work process management skills with the ability to work independently
Requirements For a Subcontractor
  • Ownership of your own truck, trailer and tools (we provide job materials)
  • Provide Certificate insurance with the following requirements:
  • General Liability - $1 Million Each Occurrence
  • Automobile Insurance, Required
  • Provide references of your past work
THE RENEWAL BY ANDERSEN ~ ESLER COMPANIES STORY

Renewal by Andersen is the full-service window replacement division of 118-year-old Andersen Corporation, the most trusted family of window brands in America. Renewal by Andersen was founded to redefine the home remodeling industry and to offer a different-and better-window-replacement experience. Renewal by Andersen has more than 120 locations across North America.

The Esler Companies is the holding company for a fleet of the top Renewal by Andersen (RbA) "affiliates" in Arizona, Colorado, Texas, Oklahoma, Greater Philadelphia, Southern New England, Southern Maine, Northern New Hampshire, and a sales and marketing 'engine' in Northborough, Massachusetts.

Esler Companies | Renewal by Andersen is a proud equal opportunity employer. We are committed to fair hiring practices and a welcoming environment for all team members.

Take a look at life at Esler Companies | Renewal by Andersen at www.esler.com

title: Clerk II - Night Crew-FR
description:
Requisition ID: 159343

Career Group: Store Careers

Job Category: Retail - Grocery

Travel Requirements: 0 - 10%

Country: Canada (CA)

Province: British Columbia

City: Richmond

Location: 4967 Seafair Safeway

Postal Code: V7C1V2

Safeway grocery stores provide an exceptional food shopping experience to consumers from Vancouver, British Columbia to Thunder Bay, Ontario. We are the newest member of Sobeys Inc.’s retail food offering which serves the needs of Canadians with more than 1,500 stores in over 800 communities from coast-to-coast. Whether it's your first job or you're ready for a new challenge, we have a career to fit your life. Our commitment to delivering top quality products and superior service to our customers, and for giving back to the communities we serve has earned us a reputation as an employer of choice for those looking for an exciting career in food retail.

Overview

About Safeway:

Safeway grocery stores provide an exceptional food shopping experience to consumers from Vancouver, British Columbia to Thunder Bay, Ontario. We are the newest member of Sobeys Inc.’s retail food offering which serves the needs of Canadians with more than 1,500 stores in over 800 communities from coast-to-coast. Whether it's your first job or you're ready for a new challenge, we have a career to fit your life. Our commitment to delivering top quality products and superior service to our customers, and for giving back to the communities we serve has earned us a reputation as an employer of choice for those looking for an exciting career in food retail.

A Day In The Life Of a Variety Clerk

As a customer yourself, you know how important it is to find exactly the health and beauty products you are looking for. Maintaining a well-stocked store so that the customer shopping experience is quick, easy and efficient is the key to building loyalty. That is why our Variety Clerks play such an important role in the success of our stores. Full training is provided for this position.

Experience

Job Description
  • No previous experienced required
Key Responsibilities
  • Upholds and complies with company procedures, standards and policies in all situations
  • Greets customers in a polite and friendly manner
  • Demonstrates superior customer service in accordance with Safeway’s programs
  • Stocking product to shelves
  • Maintaining and building merchandise displays in compliance with Safeway programs
  • Ensure standards of department presentation and operations are met; including cleanliness, rotation, ordering and superior customer service
  • Responsible for ordering and inventory control
  • Completion of associated paperwork
  • Ensure proper backroom procedures are being met
Job Requirements

Knowledge, Skills And Abilities Required
  • Ability to learn quickly
  • Ability to work in a fast paced environment
  • Highly motivated and team oriented
  • Ability to communicate clearly and concisely in both oral and written form
  • Possess strong Customer Service qualities
  • Works in a safe and responsible manner
  • Available to work flexible hours
  • Evening and weekend availability is strongly encouraged
  • Must be available to be scheduled anytime on Sunday (Alberta Only)
Physical Requirements
  • (Seldom: Not Daily, Rare: 0-5% of shift, Occasional: 6-33% of shift, Frequent: 34-66% of shift, Constant: 66-100% of shift)
  • Constant lifting of up to 5 pounds
  • Occasional lifting of between 5-50 pounds
  • Constant reaching, standing, walking, gripping
  • Frequent hand coordination, bending, squatting
  • Occasional crouching, kneeling, twisting, climbing (step ladders, stairs)
Why Work For Us
  • We offer regular pay increases for hourly employees, flexible scheduling and a comprehensive benefit plan that includes employer funded prescription drug coverage, vision care, dental coverage, and pension plan for eligible employees
  • We are looking for friendly, enthusiastic individuals who enjoy giving our customers the best shopping experience
  • If you want the chance to join one of the best retail teams in the industry, enhance your skill set, learn from experts and advance your career, this is the place to be
  • We are an award winning organization that is renowned for its inclusive work environment and recognized as a great place to work
While all responses are appreciated only those being considered for interviews will be acknowledged.

We appreciate the interest from the Staffing industry however respectfully request no calls or unsolicited resumes from Agencies.

title: Truck Mechanic (The Parkway Crew Inc)
description:
Certified Automotive or Heavy Duty Mechanic wanted in busy North Vancouver repair shop. Wage based on experience & skill level.

Our Business is Full Service Repair and Towing on the North Shore for over 25 years serving our customers and commercial fleet clients in the Vancouver area.

Who are we hiring for?
  • Certified Automotive Service Technician, Heavy Duty Mechanic or Commercial Transport Mechanic
  • Area of Specialization: all makes, diagnostics, alignment, steering and suspension, brake systems, fuel and emission systems, ignition and electrical systems, AC, cooling and heating systems and truck-trailer repair.
Requirements
  • Possess an Automotive Service Technician Trade Certification, Valid Driver's License, Motor Vehicle Inspector Certificate an asset
  • Must be capable of servicing and operating all types of vehicles
  • At least two years experience working a Mechanic in a fast-paced environment on both cars and medium to heavy trucks.
We Offer
  • Flexible work environment and opportunity for growth in the company
  • Competitive wages with starting rates based on experience and certificate level
  • Excellent benefits including medical, dental and paid vacation
The preferred candidate will be proficient in the maintenance, repair and overhaul of diesel and gas engines plus transmissions all with electronic control, along with a thorough knowledge and understanding of air brake, electrical and electronic systems.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $38.00-$46.00 per hour

Additional Pay
  • Bonus pay
Benefits
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
Licence/Certification
  • Interprovincial Red Seal/Trades Cert as HD Mechanic (preferred)
Value
skills: ['At least two years experience working a Mechanic in a fast-paced environment on both cars and medium to heavy trucks.', 'Dental care', 'Must be capable of servicing and operating all types of vehicles', 'Excellent benefits including medical, dental and paid vacation', "Possess an Automotive Service Technician Trade Certification, Valid Driver's License, Motor Vehicle Inspector Certificate an asset", 'Extended health care', 'Competitive wages with starting rates based on experience and certificate level', 'Flexible work environment and opportunity for growth in the company']

title: Agent de sécurité, Équipe flottante
description:
Prêt à revêtir l’uniforme?

Si vous cherchez un emploi où vous acquerrez diverses compétences rapidement, celui-ci est fait pour vous ! En tant qu’Agent de sécurité dans notre équipe flottante, vous travaillerez dans des environnements variés, notamment dans des immeubles en copropriété, des propriétés commerciales et des centres commerciaux.

Nous offrons à nos employés des possibilités de croissance. 30% de nos employés de première ligne sont promus pour faire partie de nos équipes opérationnelles.

Malgré les défis de la dernière année, nous élargissons nos rangs dans la ville de Québec maintenant plus que jamais ! Grâce à notre grande variété de contrats, nous avons un poste qui répondra à vos besoins et qui vous aidera à atteindre vos objectifs.

Quels sont les avantages pour vous ?
  • Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes
  • Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine
  • Uniforme fourni gratuitement
  • Opportunités de croissance avec GardaWorld
  • Formation continue avec notre Campus GardaWorld, comme emploi de la force
Que fait un agent de sécurité à Québec ?
  • Assurer la protection des personnes, des biens et des lieux
  • Contrôler les entrées et sorties avec l’équipement mis à votre disposition
  • Effectuer des rondes de surveillance préventives
  • Prévenir le feu, le vol et le vandalisme
Qualifications requises pour devenir un agent de sécurité à Québec ?
  • Un permis d'agent de sécurité et une carte de premiers soins valides
  • Être disponible pour travailler selon un horaire flexible
  • Avoir un casier judiciaire vierge
  • Être admissible à travailler au Canada
Nous souscrivons au principe de l'équité en matière d'emploi et le masculin est utilisé dans le but d'alléger le texte seulement.
skills: ['Nous offrons des salaires compétitifs et des prestations de santé complètes', 'Assurer la protection des personnes, des biens et des lieux', 'Uniforme fourni gratuitement', 'Nous pouvons garantir 40 heures par semaine']

title: Assistant Night Crew Manager/Supervisor - Part Time, 11pm-730am
description:
We're looking for talented, passionate leaders with a proven record of delighting customers and growing sales.

In this exciting role you will:
  • Lead, coach and motivate colleagues to improve productivity, engagement and retention
  • Be committed to maintaining merchandising and operational standards
  • Be accountable for departmental financial objectives
  • Be constantly on the lookout for great talent to join our team

If you want to join a fast-paced winning team and believe you can have an immediate impact, then we want to hear from you!

At Loblaw, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. If that sounds like you, and you are open-minded, responsive to change and up to the challenges provided in a fast-paced retail environment, apply today.

title: Équipier à temps partiel / Part-time Crew Member
description:
Que diriez-vous d’avoir un horaire flexible qui vous laisse assez de temps pour faire vos affaires, petites ou grandes? Que diriez-vous de pouvoir grandir professionnellement, personnellement et financièrement? Que diriez-vous d’avoir la chance de faire partie d’une entreprise dirigée par des propriétaires indépendants, qui est active dans votre collectivité et qui a aidé plus de 300 000 familles canadiennes d’enfant malade par l’entremise des Manoirs Ronald McDonald? Si tout cela vous parle, nous aimerions vous rencontrer.

VOTRE PERSONNALITÉ

Vous êtes digne de confiance et faites confiance aux autres. Vous trouvez votre bonheur dans les détails et pensez que c’est la qualité qui fait revenir les clients avant tout. Lors de situations stressantes, vous êtes cool, vous gardez votre sang-froid. Vous savez jouer en équipe et êtes une personne sociable. Vous avez compris que le service n’est pas une transaction, que c’est plutôt le moment de créer des liens avec les gens. Vous êtes d’avis qu’un sourire peut illuminer la journée de quelqu’un. Pour vous, tout ça va de soi, c’est vous tout craché.

OFFRE D’EMPLOI :

  • Satisfait les gens sur tous les fronts : accueil, prise de commande et les McFringales.
  • Prépare la nourriture et s’assure que nos célèbres hamburgers et nos célèbres frites… demeurent célèbres.
  • Traite les paiements.  Travaille à la caisse, travaille son sourire.
  • Emballe les commandes pour emporter. Mais résiste à la tentation de prendre une frite au passage… (on sait que tout le monde les adore!)
  • Gère les réfrigérateurs. Oui, c’est remplir les frigos, mais c’est vraiment important quand on sert le hamburger le plus populaire au monde.

______________________________________________________________________________________

How about flexible hours that let you do your thing, whatever your thing is. The opportunity to grow. Professionally, personally and financially. How about the chance to be part of a company that’s primarily run by independent business owners and that’s active in your community. That’s helped more than 300,000 Canadian families with sick kids through Ronald McDonald House. If that sounds good to you, then we’d love to hear from you.

YOUR VIBE

You are trustworthy and have trust in others. You find joy in the details and believe good quality is what keeps guests coming back. You remain cool, calm and collected under pressure. You understand there is no “I” in team and thrive in social situations. You get that service isn’t a transaction. It’s about connection. That a smile can make all the difference in someone’s day. It’s genuine, and it’s who you are.

YOUR JOB

FRONT COUNTER CREW / SUPER SQUAD / CRITICAL CREW

  • Making people’s day on all fronts: Greeting people, taking orders and satisfying McCravings.
  • Preparing food and keeping our world famous burgers and fries, world famous.
  • Processing payments.  Working cash, working your smile.
  • Package take-out food. But no sneaking fries…we know they’re everybody’s favourite!
  • Fridge management. Okay, it’s stocking the fridge, but it’s really important when you serve the world’s most popular burger.

Qualifications

Le poste

 

Nous sommes certains que vous avez une idée de ce que c’est que de travailler avec nous, mais au cas où, voici quelques grandes lignes sur le poste :

  • Accueillir les clients, prendre les commandes et traiter les paiements en argent comptant et par carte
  • Préparer les aliments et les boissons
  • Gérer les commandes mobiles et de livraison
  • Assembler les commandes et emballer les commandes pour emporter et pour la livraison
  • Garder toutes les surfaces propres et assainies afin d’assurer la sécurité de nos clients et de vos collègues équipiers

 

Que vous travailliez dans la cuisine, au service-au-volant ou au comptoir, vous faites partie d’une équipe dynamique qui travaille ensemble pour offrir une expérience-client exceptionnelle.

 

Notre offre

 

Travailler avec nous signifie que vous aurez l’occasion d’apprendre en travaillant, d’avoir un horaire flexible et de travailler dans un environnement sécuritaire et inclusif. Ce que cela signifie en pratique :

·       Accès à des occasions de formation et de perfectionnement de vos compétences qui vous feront progresser

·       Rémunération globale comprenant des rabais, des programmes de motivation et des avantages en reconnaissance de votre travail

·       Heures et horaire flexibles qui conviennent à vos besoins, dans les collectivités partout au Canada

·       Milieu de travail sécuritaire, respectueux et inclusif

·       Possibilité d’exprimer votre authenticité au travail – bienvenue aux personnes de tout âge, de tout horizon et de toute culture – tout comme les clients qui fréquentent nos restaurants chaque jour.

The opportunity to grow. Professionally, personally and financially. How about the chance to be part of a company that’s primarily run by independent business owners and that’s active in your community. That’s helped more than 300,000 Canadian families with sick kids through Ronald McDonald House. If that sounds good to you, then we’d love to hear from you.', 'Traite les paiements.\xa0 Travaille à la caisse, travaille son sourire.', 'Nous sommes certains que vous avez une idée de ce que c’est que de travailler avec nous, mais au cas où, voici quelques grandes lignes sur le poste\xa0:', 'Prépare la nourriture et s’assure que nos célèbres hamburgers et nos célèbres frites… demeurent célèbres.']

title: Ton emploi de rêve dans notre équipe expérience numérique
description:
Tu rêves de travailler chez BRP, mais tu n'as pas encore trouvé le poste qui te fait vibrer? Dis-nous ce que tu recherches!

Nous avons besoin de collègues passionnés et enthousiastes à joindre notre évolution numérique.

Dis-nous quel serait ton emploi de rêve si tu pouvais le créer selon tes passions. Quelles sont tes forces et dans quelles tâches excelles-tu? Comment pourrais- tu amener notre équipe numérique au niveau supérieur? Quel est ton parcours idéal chez BRP?

Nous ne voulons pas seulement que tu te joignes à l’aventure, nous voulons aussi que tu trouves le meilleur environnement de travail pour t’épanouir.

Découvrez notre expérience numérique

LA VIE CHEZ BRP

Nous créons des moyens innovants de se déplacer - sur la neige, sur l'eau, sur l'asphalte ou sur la terre - même dans les airs.

Ayant son siège social à Valcourt, au Québec, BRP réinvente la façon dont vous accédez à votre monde depuis 2003 et au-delà. Forts d’une tradition d’ingéniosité et d’une attention particulière pour notre clientèle depuis 1937, nous exploitons des installations de fabrication au Canada, aux États-Unis, au Mexique, en Finlande et en Autriche. Nous comptons sur plus de 13 000 personnes motivées et pleines de ressources.

Notre gamme de produits de pointe et distinctifs comprend les motoneiges Ski-Doo et Lynx, les motomarines Sea-Doo, les véhicules hors route et sur route Can-Am, les bateaux Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer et Savage, les systèmes de propulsion marine Evinrude et Rotax, de même que les moteurs Rotax pour karts, motocyclettes et avions de loisir. Nous soutenons nos gammes de produits avec une entreprise spécialisée dans les pièces, les accessoires et les vêtements, afin d'améliorer pleinement votre expérience de conduite.

Parce que ce n’est pas à propos de la destination. C’est à propos du voyage. Le tien.

Nos gens sont passionnés et qualifiés; en joignant BRP, vous évoluerez au sein d’une équipe chevronnée qui vous accueillera à bras ouverts.

Suivez-nous sur :

LinkedIn @BRP;

Twitter @BRPnouvelles;

Facebook @BRPinfo.

title: Traducteur(trice) - Équipe Technique
description:
Aperçu

Les Services linguistiques de KPMG à Montréal souhaitent pourvoir un poste de traducteur pour leur équipe de traduction technique.

Il s’agit d’un poste permanent à temps plein. Le candidat doit avoir un maximum de sept années d’expérience en traduction, principalement dans les domaines de la comptabilité et des finances, dans un environnement professionnel structuré ou au sein d’un cabinet comptable.

Ce que vous ferez
  • Traduire des documents variés de nature technique, notamment en comptabilité, en audit, en fiscalité et en gestion des risques
  • Respecter les délais et se conformer à des critères de qualité élevés
  • Gérer des projets d’envergure
  • Travailler en collaboration avec les membres de l’équip
  • Maximiser l’utilisation des outils et s’investir dans l’apprentissage continu
Ce que vous apportez au rôle
  • Baccalauréat en traduction ou diplôme équivalent
  • Connaissance des normes de comptabilité et d’audit
  • Excellente capacité d’apprentissage
  • Forte aptitude à effectuer des recherches
  • Sens aigu de la qualité et du service à la clientèle
  • Grand souci du détail
  • Bonne gestion du stress et de la pression
  • Attitude positive et capacité à travailler en équipe
  • Capacité à gérer des projets
  • Maîtrise des outils technologiques
  • Autonomie et souplesse
  • Ouverture, franchise et clarté dans les communications
  • Connaissance avancée de LogiTerm, un atout
  • Membre de l’OTTIAQ ou d’un organisme équivalent, un atout
Nos valeurs, la façon KPMG

Intégrité, nous faisons ce qui est juste | Excellence, nous ne cessons jamais d’apprendre et de nous améliorer | Courage, nous pensons et agissons avec audace | Ensemble, nous nous respectons les uns les autres et puisons notre force dans nos différences | Pour le mieux, nous faisons en sorte que notre travail compte

KPMG s’engage à assurer la santé et la sécurité de son personnel, de ses clients et de ses communautés. Dans cette optique, KPMG se conforme à toutes les directives en matière de santé publique (au niveau provincial et/ou fédéral, selon le cas) et a mis en œuvre diverses mesures de sécurité, dont une Politique sur la vaccination contre la COVID-19. En vertu de cette politique, tous les employés qui souhaitent ou qui doivent accéder aux bureaux de KPMG dans le cadre de leurs fonctions.

Étant donné que ce poste exige une présence occasionnelle ou régulière dans un bureau de KPMG, le candidat retenu doit être entièrement vacciné (c.-à-d. avoir reçu toutes les doses recommandées par Santé Canada, y compris les doses de rappel) et fournir à KPMG une preuve de vaccination. Si le candidat retenu ne peut être vacciné en raison d’un motif protégé en vertu des lois sur les droits de la personne dans sa province d’emploi, KPMG lui accordera des mesures d’adaptation raisonnables.

KPMG au Canada souscrit fièrement au principe de l’égalité d’accès à l’emploi et s’engage à offrir un environnement de travail respectueux, inclusif et sans obstacle, permettant ainsi à tous les membres de son personnel de se réaliser pleinement. Un effectif diversifié est la clé de notre réussite et nous croyons à notre mission qui vise à ce que vous soyez complètement vous-même au travail. Nous invitons tous les candidats qualifiés à se manifester et nous espérons que vous ferez de KPMG au Canada votre employeur de choix.

Pour toute question de recrutement d’ordre général, communiquez avec le Centre de prestation des RH à l’adresse cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.

Si vous avez des questions en matière d’accessibilité à l’emploi chez KPMG ou si vous désirez entamer une conversation confidentielle à propos de vos besoins personnels en matière d’accessibilité et de mesures d’aménagement pendant le processus de recrutement, nous vous encourageons à communiquer avec notre Service des relations avec les employés, par courriel au cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca ou par téléphone au 416-777-8002 ou sans frais au 1-888-466-4778.
skills: ['Grand souci du détail', 'Travailler en collaboration avec les membres de l’équip', 'Attitude positive et capacité à travailler en équipe']
