title: newRegistered EMT - Paramedic
description:
Your Opportunity:

Our team provides exemplary emergency room care for patients in a collaborative, interdisciplinary team environment. As a Registered EMT - Paramedic, you will play an important role in supporting and integrated and holistic approach to patient care, health promotion and maintenance. You will contribute your nursing assessment, interpersonal and written documentation skills to assist with the treatment of trauma-associated injury. You will provide safe, quality patient and family centered care while reflecting the shared vision and values of AHS. You will enjoy working at our new Regional Hospital and Cancer Centre scheduled to open this fall. The city of Grande Prairie has something for everyone. We are a growing city with close to 70,000 residents and serving approximately 260,000 people in the surrounding area. In addition to a state of the art recreation facility, there are numerous parks and golf courses, and a vibrant arts and culture community. If you are reliable, motivated, and thrive in a dynamic environment, come join our team! In addition to a competitive rate of pay, AHS currently has a Remote Retention Allowance in place to an annual maximum of $3,000. This allowance is non-pensionable and is payable on an hourly basis for all hours paid at the basic rate of pay.

Description:

As a Paramedic, you will assess emergency scenes and patients and may transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation. You will treat patients by administering medications, advanced life support (ALS) airway adjuncts and electrical therapy. You may also lead the ALS crew in delivering clinical care during patient transport or at emergency scenes. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped.

title: Flight Nurse RN Class A
description:
Competition 2022001, Permanent Full Time Position, Moncton



Permanent Full Time Position

Moncton


Ambulance New Brunswick (ANB) provides land and air ambulance services in New Brunswick.

We are currently searching for a highly motivated and qualified registered nurse to staff a permanent full time position as a Flight Nurse with the provincial air ambulance service.

Flight nursing is a challenging specialty performed in a unique out-of-hospital environment. It is a distinctive and expanded role for a registered nurse that encompasses the air medical transport of critically ill and injured pediatric (greater than 28 days corrected) and adult patients.

The flight nurse practices autonomously within the scope of practice, policies, procedures and guidelines defined by ANB, and in accordance with the Nurses Association of New Brunswick’s regulations and standards. The flight nurse also practices collaboratively with members of the air medical crew, medical control physicians, paramedics, communications specialists, pilots and other personnel.


As the ideal candidate for this position, you:

  • are currently registered or are eligible to be registered as a Registered Nurse (RN) in the province of New Brunswick;
  • possess a minimum 3 years’ experience caring for critically ill or injured patients; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience;
  • hold current certifications in BCLS, ACLS and PALS;
  • possess previous experience in flight nursing or transport nursing duties (an asset);
  • are willing to obtain certification in PHTLS/TNCC (or equivalent) within six months of employment;
  • are able to successfully complete required flight training, including but not limited to: flight physiology, flight safety, and land and sea survival training;
  • are able to successfully complete training for performance of required post entry-level competencies;
  • must be willing to work rotating 12 hour shifts; start time 0730 and 1930 respectively, 1.0 FTE.
  • possess the ability to function within and work efficiently as a member of a multidisciplinary team.

Written & Spoken competence in English or French is required. Submit your application: hr-rh@ambulancenb.ca.

You will receive an automatic e-mail confirmation upon successful receipt of your application. No phone calls please.

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Any candidate not currently employed in the New Brunswick Public Service will need to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19, or a valid medical certificate exempting them from the vaccine.

Ambulance New Brunswick is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees is an equal opportunity employer.

title: High Acuity Response Nurse
description:
Job title :HIGH ACUITY RESPONSE NURSE
Community :PENTICTON
Facility :PENTICTON REGIONAL HSPTL
Status :CASUAL

Position Summary


Touching Lives! Room for Growth! Independent Practice! These are just a few of the descriptions that describe Interior Health’s High Acuity Response Team (HART) program and we are seeking critical care trained and experienced transport nurses to be part of this new and innovative program.

This program provides comprehensive, regionally coordinated ground transport care for critical care patients from institutions. Our mobile critical care response team includes highly skilled nursing professionals who perform vital analyses and procedures as needed on-site and in transit. This ground transport team covers Central and South Okanagan- from Kelowna to Oosyoos and Princeton to Grand Forks- to provide critical care in outlying facilities and transport patients to the best available care as quickly as possible.

Providing interfacility transportation for patients requiring advanced life support (ALS) or critical care management to or from tertiary hospitals is of particular importance, and is one of the primary reasons for using the Penticton HART team.

The service will bring critical care nurses by ambulance to the hospital when a situation requires an advanced level of care that the ambulance crew cannot perform. These nurses work under the medical direction of the regional medical director and utilize standing protocols which provide advanced medical care and will enhance the emergency lifesaving capabilities of the local EMS providers.

When not involved in transports, HART RNs integrate into their base hospital by providing support to critical care areas such as ICU and ER, participating in rapid response, code blue, critical care outreach to the wards, rounding on recent ICU discharges and other duties as required.

If you like a challenge when you work, opportunities for funded training, and choices when you play, Interior Health is the place for you! Apply Today!

Qualifications


  • Graduation from an approved School of Nursing with current practicing registration with the British Columbia College of Nurses and Midwives (BCCNM).

  • Successful completion of an accredited critical care training course and/or certificate, a minimum of three years recent related experience caring for critically ill/injured patients including experience performing inter-facility patient transfers; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


  • Successful completion of an accredited trauma course such as Transport Nurse Advanced Trauma Course, International Trauma Life Support Course (ITLS), Trauma Nursing Care Course (TNCC), Pre-Hospital Trauma Life Support Course (PHTLS); or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.


  • Current certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support.


  • Current valid BC Driver’s License.

title: Respiratory Therapist | Casual Pool
description:
Job title :RESPIRATORY THERAPIST | CASUAL POOL
Community :PENTICTON
Facility :PENTICTON REGIONAL HSPTL
Status :CASUAL

Position Summary


Penticton Regional Hospital (PRH) is seeking to expand its Respiratory Team and is inviting applications from Respiratory Therapists (RTs) interested in Casual employment.

Casual employment means work requirements can vary between Zero and 37.5 hours per week. Shifts will include a mix of weekdays, weekends, days, and nights. Some shifts will be pre booked and some will be short notice. Opportunity to apply for Regular employment positions within the Internal Recruitment job posting process.

What Will You Work On?
Respiratory Therapy staff support Acute Care, such as intubation, arterial line insertion, ventilation management, high risk delivery and neonatal resuscitation/ventilation, non-invasive ventilation, bronchoscopy, education, tracheostomy changes and care, etc. Respiratory Therapy staff also support Community in ways such as education, trach changes, chest tube drainage, education.

Interior Health’s High Acuity Response Team (HART) program operates at PRH offering Respiratory Therapists to be part of comprehensive, regionally coordinated ground transport care for critical care patients. This service brings Critical Care Nurses and Respiratory Therapists by ambulance when a situation requires an advanced level of care that the ambulance crew cannot perform. On call required for HART.

How Will You Create Impact?
You will be part of a team that provides a high level of care to our patients. Our roll at PRH offers the Respiratory Therapist autonomy and opportunity to perform majority of procedures and grow in experience.

How Will We Help You Grow?
Tailored orientation to successful applicant and depending which position. New grads normally receive longer orientations generally. CPR, NRP, ACLS, PALS, ITLS, ACORN, and Advanced Airway Management courses are provided for HART Respiratory Therapists. Learning plans, succession planning, mentoring are available to help a Respiratory Therapist grow in skills and knowledge. Opportunities available to participate in multiple committees in all areas of practice.

Who Are We Looking For?
Self-motivated and reliable Respiratory Therapists with a good attitude. Abundance of Casual hours/shifts available for the flexible and reliable Respiratory Therapist.

Qualifications


  • Graduation from a recognized Respiratory Therapy program.

  • Current certification with the Canadian Society of Respiratory Therapists (CSRT) and eligible for registration with the British Columbia Society of Respiratory Therapists (BCSRT) and CSRT.

  • Recent acute/critical care experience.

  • Current valid BC Driver’s License.


    • Interior Health now offers assistance from an Aboriginal Employment Advisor. If you self-identify as Aboriginal and would like assistance with tips on resume and cover letter writing, the Interior Health application process, or interview readiness, send us your query via email to AboriginalEmployment@interiorhealth.ca to reach an Employment Advisor.

description:

Precision Well Servicing operates the largest fleet of service rigs in Canada, offering a wide range of products focused upon safety and quality.

Rewarding Oil and Gas careers are available!

Begin, or continue to build, your career with Precision Well Servicing!

We offer all our Field Team Employees the rewards of a stable income through our optional Stability+ Plan, as well as, progressive development and promotion through our mentorship and continuous training programs. All of the programs are designed to keep you safe at work, in control of your career, and offer financial stability to you and your family.

The Stability+ Plan offers our Field Team a continuous paycheque, 26 paycheques a year. Ask us about it!

We are currently seeking entry-level and experienced workers.

All of our team members are supported and mentored in the GROW program - seeking to provide you with the tools to be successful and safe in the field.

The Stability+ Plan offers:

Precision is the largest Service Rig provider in Canada, with an impressive fleet of equipment and strong relationships with top-tier companies, all of which enable us to provide you with the rewarding career you are searching for. In addition, Precision also offers:

  • Supportive team, from the field crew teams right to the Vice President and President of PWS, and all the levels in between.

title: Flight Nurse
description:
Vanguard Air Care is currently accepting applications from loyal, dedicated, experienced Registered Nurse with the energy and a positive attitude to join our aero-medical transport team of dedicated, caring health care providers.

Vanguard Air Care Headquarters is located in Winnipeg, Manitoba and operates out of (4) air ambulance bases strategically located in Manitoba: (Winnipeg, Island Lake, Norway House and Thompson)

Vanguard Air Care is pleased to offer a competitive compensation package to the successful applicant.

Education and Experience Requirements:

The applicant must have successfully graduated from a recognized Registered Nursing program. The applicant must also have successfully completed a critical care nursing and or an emergency nursing course or verification of at least 2 years of related nursing experience and the following:

  • Valid registration with the College of Registered Nurses of Manitoba with no restrictions.
  • Current Basic Life Support
  • Current Advance Cardiac Life Support
  • Current Pediatric Advance Life Support
  • Current International Trauma Life Support / Pre-hospital Trauma Life Support or Trauma Nursing Core Course
  • CAMATA or equivalent certificate
  • Immunizations including COVID-19 must be up to date

Other minimum requirements:

  • Criminal Record including Vulnerable Person clearance
  • Manitoba Child Abuse Registry clearance
  • Must be able to obtain a Transport Canada RAIC pass
  • Physically capable of performing the duties of a Flight Nurse.
  • Willing to work in remote locations without supervision
  • Willing and able to work during various weather conditions
  • Must provide a valid passport

Skills:

  • Maintains positive interpersonal relationships with colleagues, Paramedic Services representatives, hospitals, nursing stations, and the public while executing strong interpersonal skills and a high degree of collaboration at all levels.
  • Demonstrates high critical thinking and reasoning skills and strong attention to detail while working in an environment that requires ability to prioritize and multi-task.
  • Ability to work a flexible schedule.
  • Dependable and self-motivated while working in a frequently changing environment.
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, both written and verbal

Responsibilities:

  • The Flight Nurse will assess, treat, prepare patient for transport and accompany patients on the Air Ambulance to the receiving facility.
  • The Flight Nurse will be required to be knowledgeable in use and routine maintenance of all equipment and supplies used by Vanguard Air Care.
  • Responsible for reporting medical equipment failures and taking initial steps to ensure repair of equipment as directed.
  • The Flight Nurse will keep the aircraft clean and orderly to insure rapid response to all transport requests.
  • The Flight Nurse will represent Vanguard Air Care and its affiliates in a professional and respectful manner at all times and reports directly to the Director of Medevac Services or designate.
  • The Flight Nurse works closely and effectively with other members of the air ambulance crew to ensure a positive outcome for all stakeholders.
  • The Flight Nurse will maintain his/her documents of required licensure, certifications, continuing education and any other relevant training to his/her scope of practice.
  • The Flight Nurse will serve as a role model, educator and clinical resource. Participates in departmental activities, projects and committees.
  • The Flight Nurse will maintain awareness of current issues related to transport care through participation in professional activities.

Schedule:

Vanguard Air Care is currently seeking applications for the following opening:

  • Full time 14 days on 14 days off rotation.

Preference for employment will be given to those individuals who currently reside in Manitoba or willing to relocate from another province.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: From $42.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • On call

Education:

  • Bachelor's Degree (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Registered Nurse (RN) License (required)
Show more

title: Primary Care Paramedic
description:
We are seeking Primary Care Paramedics (EMT/PCP) to join our team as occupational paramedics for upcoming camp based positions in the Northwest Territories.

As an EMT/PCP your main role on site will be to provide emergency response to crews in the event of injury, illness, or emergency situation.

General Responsibilities:

Determine the nature and extent of illness or injury to establish care procedures

Administer pre-hospital first-aid treatment and emergency care at site of emergency, or in specially equipped vehicle.

Establish and maintain IV treatment, apply adjunctive equipment for ventilation and circulation complications, administer medications.

Collect and maintain pertinent and confidential patient medical information and maintain detailed records of the nature of injuries/illnesses and treatment provided.

Communicate with medical personnel at emergency treatment facilities and assist medevac personnel with provision of medical treatment as necessary.

Maintain ambulances and emergency care equipment and supplies

Perform nasopharyngeal swabs for covid-19 testing

Qualifications:

Valid, unrestricted EMT/PCP certificate with current CPR certificate

Previous experience as an EMT/PCP (industrial experience an asset but not required)

Effective communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills

Ability to stay calm and collected in stressful and emergency situations

Ability to maintain positive, professional relations with a wide range of individuals

Be comfortable working long hours for many consecutive days

Be extremely safety conscious

Possess a reasonable level of fitness Valid Class 4 or 5 driver's license.

62 Degrees North is an equal opportunity employer. We provide competitive salaries and a supportive work environment. Depending on the work location transportation to and from site, meals, and accommodations could be provided.

Are you an experienced medical professional seeking rewarding work? Apply today.

Job Type: Contract

Job Types: Full-time, Fly-In/Fly-Out

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Application question(s):

  • Are you legally entitled to work in Canada?

Work remotely:

  • No

title: Advance Care Flight Paramedic Part-Time Casual
description:
SkyCare is currently searching for motivated, energetic and career-driven Advance Care Flight Paramedics to join our team. We have vacancies for part-time ACP(F) paramedics who are Ornge Base Hospital certified, or willing to certify under the ORNGE BH. Shifts will be available in Thunder Bay and Kitchener, Ontario. Travel and accommodations are provided.

Compensation is based on experience. As the shifts are on call, Paramedics are compensated a generous day rate whether called into work or remaining at the crew accommodations.

SkyCare provides Air Ambulance services to the Province of Ontario through a Standing Offer Agreement managed by ORNGE. Our flight crews provide 24-hour coverage, 365 days a year.

SkyCare aircraft are used for Primary Care, Advanced Care, and Specialty Team transports (CHEO, NICU, ECMO, etc). Our Metro aircraft are among the largest and most capable Air Ambulance platforms in the provincial system, and have the ability to provide bariatric and emergent team transport capabilities. SkyCare also utilizes a Westwind Jet medevac platform that has best-in-class range, allowing for non-stop transcontinental flights, which is a great tool for long haul transfers. Along with provincial flights, SkyCare has a private repatriation stretcher service that can move patients internationally from destinations in North American, Mexico, and the Caribbean.

SkyCare currently operates 7 medevac aircraft from 3 bases in Ontario: Kitchener, Thunder Bay and Sioux Lookout.

ACP(F) Job Responsibilities (not inclusive):

  • Pre-Flight check of the aircraft
  • Communicating with ORNGE dispatch and ORNGE TMP’s.
  • Providing care to patients on board the aircraft, in compliance with the ORNGE medical directives, ALS and all other governing laws.
  • Post-Flight Checks—cleaning, organizing, restocking the aircraft, etc.
  • Deep cleans of the patient care area, Aircraft and equipment.

Position Requirements

  • Currently Certified and in good standing with ORNGE Base Hospital as a ACP(F) or CCP
  • Able to provide documentation as per MOH Standards for OASIS Card (List of requirements will be provided upon hire)

Please submit a resume (cover letter not required)

Start date: Immediately

Application deadline: Open until filled

Job Types: Part Time Casual

Reference ID: SkyCare ACP(F) PT- 2022

Job Types: Part-time, Fly-In/Fly-Out, Casual

Salary: From $55.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • On call

Application question(s):

  • Are you currently certified with ORNGE Base Hospital as an ACP(F) or CCP?

Work remotely:

  • No
Show more

title: HR Specialist – Recruitment & Performance Mgmt.
description:
#17 Airport Road
P.O. Box 289
Sioux Lookout, Ontario P8T 1A3
Tel: 807.737.0038 Fax: 807.737.0040

HR Specialist – Recruitment & Performance Mgmt.

SkyCare is a growing and dynamic Air Ambulance and Air Charter Service based in Sioux Lookout, Ontario. With additional bases in Manitoba and Southern Ontario, we provide private, corporate, and medevac flight services across Canada and the United States. Our flight crews and ground personnel are dedicated to providing the highest level of safety, comfort, and care to our clients.

Job Summary

We are actively seeking an HR Specialist to join our team to administer and manage the recruitment, placement, and performance evaluation of employees. Their overall goal is to ensure the best employees are hired for all positions within the Company and are provided with appropriate guidance to reach their full potential.

Responsibilities

The HR Specialist is responsible for creating and placing job postings and actively identifying and recruiting new talent through multiple recruiting channels including job fairs and social media. They work closely with management to understand hiring needs and establish industry relationships to attract the best talent for the SkyCare team. They lead the recruitment, interview, and offer process with the support of the appropriate manager. The HR Specialist also manages the framework for employee evaluations, reviews, promotions, and retention.

Qualifications

  • Post-secondary diploma or degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.
  • Certified Human Resources Professional (CHRP) designation considered an asset
  • 2-4 years working experience in a Human Resources department preferred.
  • Practical knowledge of HR applications such as talent acquisition, recruitment, employment interviews, employee engagement, and performance evaluations.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Closing Date: Open until filled.

Compensation: Commensurate with education and experience.

Benefits:

  • Extended health, vision, dental care, life, and long-term disability insurance
  • Employee & Family Assistance Program
  • Group Retirement Savings Plan
  • Professional Development Opportunities

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Salary: $53,000.00-$65,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Casual dress
  • Dental care
  • Disability insurance
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • Paid time off
  • RRSP match
  • Vision care

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

title: Patient Transfer Attendant
description:
Company description

Pioneer provides Non urgent patient transfer services to Hospitals, nursing homes, government facilities and the general public.

Job description

Patient Transfer Attendant

We are seeking Care Attendants for our Patient Transfer Service to assist members of our communities transfer between medical facilities. If you are looking for a career where you feel you could make a difference in, please read below!

A basic job, attracts basic pay – we believe that our crews should have the ability to increase their earnings if they wish - unlike many other employers, who ban / avoid higher paid overtime. Our compensation package includes hourly wage, with increases after 6 months and 12 months of employment, an annual Bonus, and an attractive Group Benefits Program.

Required:

  • A valid Class 'G' Ontario Driver's License, with 5 years total driving experience and a clean abstract.
  • A current valid First Aid qualification - Preferably Advanced First Aid or higher
  • The ability to pass a Criminal Record Check to work with children and vulnerable adults
  • Proven Vaccinations or Immunity to 8 Viruses in accordance with the Immunization Policy for Health Care Workers
  • Both doses of the Covid-19 vaccination

About Us:

We are a leading provider of non-emergency, patient transfers for medically stable patients throughout the Lower Mainland. Using our specially equipped fleet of Ambulances and Accessible vehicles, and ensuring they are transferred in a safe, compassionate and efficient manner.

Skills and Abilities:

  • Physically fit, ability to lift, push or pull 250+ lbs using a wheelchair, stretcher or stair chair with a partner.

title: Mental Health Transport Nurses (4)
description:
IMMEDIATE INTERIM OPPORTUNITY

Mental Health Transport Nurses (4)
Department: Paramedic Operations
Reports To: Mental Health Transport Project Lead
Duration: 12 Months
Location: Thunder Bay, ON
Accommodation and Flights provided (Part Time)

Our Client, an emergency healthcare services provider, seeks Mental Health Transport Nurses, who will work with a team of Primary Care Paramedics, Healthcare Security guards, and flight crew on a high profile new project to provide increased mental health support to the North. This pool will be completely trained and onboarded to support the program and will be asked on an adhoc basis to fly out to the Thunder Bay base for a 7 day rotation. The nurses will provide medical care and safe transport of urgent and non-urgent mental health patients by air and or land between medical facilities. The ideal candidates will be Registered Nurses who have experience working in the Acute Mental Health field and can administer narcotics during the medical transport of patients .

Key Accountabilities:

  • Provide clinical care to mental health patients including stabilization, preparation for transport, and care during transport through to transfer of care at a receiving facility.
  • Maintain necessary clinical equipment, equipment bags, and biomedical equipment in a state of readiness for any emergency response.
  • Follow all routine and enhanced practices for infection prevention and control including post-call cleaning and disinfection of aircraft and equipment as required.
  • Complete paper-based and/or electronic documentation of patient care in accordance with the Standards of Practice of the Colleges of Nurses of Ontario and/or Ministry of Health.

Competencies and Requirements:

  • Post-graduate degree in Nursing.
  • Current active registration in good standing with the College of Nurses of Ontario.
  • Current active certification in Advanced Cardiac Life Support (ACLS).
  • Current active certification in Basic Cardiac Life Support (BCLS) for Healthcare including AED.
  • Specialized training in mental health nursing, or in critical care/emergency nursing.
  • Minimum of five years of practice in a Hospital-Based Acute Care Mental Health nursing setting.
  • Minimum of two years of practice in an Emergency Room and/or Intensive Care Unit setting.
  • Preferred experience in providing care in remote indigenous communities, and in a transport environment (air ambulance or similar), nationally or internationally.

LHH Knightsbridge Interim Management is a service to help our clients address a wide range of scenarios including leadership support due to sudden departures, driving key change initiatives or leading transformation projects. Our interim executives step in with minimal downtime to meet specific objectives and deliver results. All have held senior positions in the past and have now chosen to offer their unique depth and breadth of experience to organizations on a limited engagement basis. Follow the LHH Knightsbridge LinkedIn page and set up a job alert to learn about new Executive Interim opportunities.

Lee Hecht Harrison Knightsbridge Corp. is committed to providing equitable treatment and accommodation to ensure a barrier-free recruitment process. In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and our AODA policy, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of the hiring process. If you require accommodation to apply or if selected to participate in an assessment process, please provide your accommodation needs in advance to the Recruitment Lead for this opportunity.

We thank all interested candidates in advance; however, only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

May 2022

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Fixed term contract

Salary: $40.00-$50.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift

title: Certified Flagger
description:
Flaggers are typically employed by agencies, or construction companies to control the flow of traffic around road construction sites. They erect warning and detour signs, position traffic cones and barricades, and inform the construction crew of any safety hazards.

Note - Pay Rate for this Job is $16.00/Hour - $17.00/Hour

Shift Timing - All Available

Responsibilities Include:
  • A traffic control person may also be known as a flag person (flag woman/flag man) or signaler. The main role is to:
  • Stop, slow, and safely direct traffic through work or construction sites.
  • Protect workers in the construction zone by regulating traffic flow.
  • Give traffic control directions and signals clearly and precisely so that motorists understand their meaning.
  • Keep the flow of traffic moving with as few delays as possible.
  • Only use traffic control persons when other methods of traffic control are not adequate.
  • Always use barriers, barricades, lane control devices, traffic signal lights, sign trucks, and other methods as appropriate instead of, and/or in addition to, traffic control persons to ensure the safety of all workers.
  • What should a traffic control person know before each job? Before starting each job, know:
  • The overall traffic protection plan and layout of the traffic control zone.
  • Your duties, role and responsibilities.
  • That you have the right training for this job, and that you understand your duties.
  • What activities will be done on the work or construction site (e.g., paving, grading, etc.).
  • What equipment is present and how the equipment will be operated (e.g., scrapers, trucks, graders, etc.).
  • What personal protective equipment is required.
  • Practices and procedures for that job (how to stop and slow traffic), where to stand, etc. The traffic control zone will vary depending on the speed allowed on the roadway, volume of traffic, weather conditions, if there is a curve or hill, etc.
  • What communication methods will be used, including how to use radios, hand signals, etc.
  • What to do in an emergency, including your personal escape route in case a vehicle comes too close.
  • Be sure you have adequate eye sight and hearing ability to do this job safely.
  • How communication will be handled if there is a need for a third (or more) traffic control person, such as when the work zone is around curves or hills where sight lines to the other end of the work zone are obstructed.
  • That the “stop-slow” sign you will use is in good repair (e.g., undamaged, clean).
  • That measures are in place and at appropriate distances to give motorist enough warning to slow down.
  • How to report incidents (near-misses, accidents, etc.).
  • That a traffic control person should never leave their position unattended (e.g., know what the arrangements are for meals and breaks).
Qualifications:
  • Always stay alert. The situation can change very quickly.
  • Be visible. Stand where you can see traffic, and be seen by traffic.
  • Think ahead and plan your escape route. Know where you will move to if a motorist drives too close.
  • Stand “alone”, which in this case means do not stand in a group of people, or beside or in a vehicle or other distractions. Drivers must be able to see you clearly.
  • Stand the correct distance from the work area. This position will vary with the visibility, speed and volume of traffic. In general, this spot is halfway between the beginning of the taper or detour zone, and the traffic control person sign. Do not stand too close to the taper, or in the travel lane.
  • Keep visual contact with the other traffic control person if you are not using radios.
  • Work as a team with other traffic control persons. Always check with the other traffic control person to see if it is safe to allow traffic to move. When two or more traffic control persons are required to work as a team at the worksite, responsibility for coordination of changes in traffic flow could be assigned to one person.
  • Hold the stop/slow sign away from your body, and in the driver's line of sight.
  • Raise your free hand with the palm facing the driver to stop traffic.
  • Allow time for the vehicle to stop safely by turning the sign when the vehicle is at an appropriate distance away for the speed it is travelling.
  • After stopping the first vehicle, move to a safe position where the incoming next vehicle can see you.
  • Be aware of everything going on around you, behind you, lane beside you, etc.
  • When you are ready to release traffic, return to your position outside the travel lane, confirm with the other traffic control person it is safe to let traffic move, turn the sign to “slow”, and with your free arm, signal to drivers to proceed.
  • To slow moving traffic, extend the slow sign away from your body (but do not wave it), and use your free hand in an up and down motion (palm down).
  • Be alert for emergency vehicles (police, fire, ambulance). These vehicles have priority through the traffic control zone.
  • Guide cyclists and pedestrians safely through the zone as well.
  • Cover or remove traffic control person signs when there are no traffic control persons present.
  • Do not assume a vehicle will stop until it has actually come to a full and complete stop.
  • Do not look away from on-coming traffic.
  • Do not do any other activity, other than control traffic.
  • Do not use other devices (other than your communication radio) which may distract you or impair your sight, hearing or take attention from the job. These devices include personal music players, cell phones, etc. Only use a cell phone for on-site emergency communication, if permitted.
  • Do not participate in arguments with motorists. Be polite, do not retaliate, stay back, and stay safe. If necessary, record the incident and report it to your supervisor.
  • Do not try to enforce situations that appear to be breaking highway traffic acts (e.g., speeding, dangerous driving, driving while impaired, etc.). Make a note of the licence plate on the vehicle, and discuss with your supervisor. Call the police or emergency services for assistance.
  • Do not use radio communication when blasting activities are occurring.
  • Able to work outdoors in all weather conditions
  • Communication skills required - flaggers remain in constant contact with the crew
  • Able to remain in a stationary position for long periods at a time
  • Possess a valid flagger certification
Show more

title: Dispatcher / Flight Follower - Air Ambulance Operations
description:
Medevac Dispatcher / Flight Follower - Air Ambulance Operations

SkyNorth Air is accepting resumes for the position of Dispatcher - Medevac Operations. Please see the key responsibilities, and skills / qualifications required for the position listed below:

  • Monitor all aircraft to ensure safe departure and arrivals as per Type D Flight Following system
  • Schedule crews for flights and respond to all crew enquiries with regards to their duties
  • Accept in-bound calls from a central coordination center (MTCC) in regards to availability and dispatch of aircraft and crews
  • Work closely with MTCC to determine their trip needs and ensure correct information is passed on to AMS staff in a timely manner
  • Support Pilot and AMS staff with regards to trip details and station stop requirements (Fuel Orders, Transportation needs)
  • Generate the trip sheets for the crew and provide relevant documentation for flights
  • Organize hotel accommodation for crews at destination if required
  • Assist with the interpretation of all flight documents and information for the Accounting and Maintenance Depts.
  • General office administration duties
  • Other duties as assigned
  • Skills and Qualifications:
  • Ability to work in a 24/7 operating environment
  • Ability to communicate effectively and tactfully with a diverse group of people
  • Excellent time management skills and ability to prioritize work for maximum efficiency
  • Ability to demonstrate a professional approach and work well under pressure
  • Self-starter and ability to act independently under minimal supervision
  • Excellent interpersonal and quality service skills
  • Proficiency in common computer applications: Word, Excel, Outlook, Adobe
  • Previous experience in Aviation Customer Service, or Aviation Operations desired
  • Proof of Covid-19 vaccination required for employment.

Education: Secondary School Diploma or sufficient experience

Compensation: As per company scale, with standard company benefits.

Please respond/submit CV via email only, due to Covid-19 protocols in person drop offs not permitted. No phone calls please.

We thank all those who apply in advance.

Please note: Only potential, qualified candidates will be contacted.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match

Schedule:

  • 12 hour shift
Show more

title: Duty Officer
description:
Latitude Air Ambulance is looking for a Duty Officer to join our dynamic team in the Operational Control Center. If you are looking for a challenge and enjoy working in a fast-paced, exciting environment, we would love to meet with you!


The successful candidate would be responsible for the following:


  • Setting itineraries and schedules; managing air ambulance transfers
  • Dispatching flight crews
  • Arranging ground ambulance, fueling, Customs, aircraft handling, crew hotel rooms, commercial flight booking, taxi and limousine services in conjunction with air ambulance transfers
  • Communicating with customers/clients with a very high degree of professionalism, courtesy and sensitivity at all times
  • Receiving and processing transportation requests from clients
  • Providing air ambulance quotations (as required)
  • Flight following, completing and filling out forms
  • Logging and detailing all information; storage by hard copy and data base
  • Working seamlessly with flight, medical, maintenance, customer service and accounting personnel
  • Other duties and responsibilities as required

Qualifications:


  • Fluent in English (required); Bilingual/fluent in language other than English considered an asset
  • Administrative work experience in the fields of transportation, travel, dispatch, medical or other related industries would be considered an asset
  • Education/Training/Certification in Flight Dispatch is an asset
  • Knowledge of geography within North America and/or worldwide an asset
  • Strong computer skills including typing, navigating different programs and sending/receiving a high volume of emails
  • Ability to deal with people professionally and tactfully at all times
  • Excellent customer service skills
  • Strong problem solving and critical-thinking skills
  • Flexible and adaptable to change
  • Able to deal well under pressure and work in a fast-paced environment
  • Well organized with attention to detail
  • able to work shift rotation as set out by the company including Statutory Holidays/Weekends
  • Must have G2 or higher license and be able to provide own transportation to and from John C. Munro Hamilton International Airport (public transportation is not available for all shift times)

What’s in it for you?


  • Work 4 shifts on, then have 4 days off every week! (Shift rotation includes weekends and holidays/ 12 hour, day and night shifts)
  • Competitive starting salary with progressive wage increases
  • Benefits (EHC/Dental/Drug Plan, etc.)
  • Group RRSP program
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Corporate phone plan discounts with Telus
  • Work for a company that values Compassion, Integrity & Trust
  • Team atmosphere with a ‘Family’ feel
  • Social Events; River Day/Summer BBQ, Christmas Parties, etc.
  • Catered lunches on the last Friday of every month

On the job training provided.If you are interested in joining a fast-growing company and are looking to grow as an individual and as a team player, please send us your resume and cover letter!

If you were referred by an existing team member, let us know.


We thank all applicants for applying but only those successful will be contacted.


Latitude Air Ambulance is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability and conviction for an offence for which a pardon has been granted or in respect of which a record suspension has been ordered. or any other protected characteristic as outlined by the Canada Human Rights Act.


This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Latitude Air Ambulance makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.


Latitude Air Ambulance welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a disability related accommodation during the application process under the Accessible Canada Act please reach out to hr@latitude2009.com

title: Security Attendant I (Security & Stage Door Attendant)
description:
Requisition ID: 35650



Company

Located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh), Vancouver has a commitment to becoming a City of Reconciliation. Vancouver consistently ranks as one of the world’s most liveable cities and is working towards being the greenest city in the world. Named among Canada's Top 100 Employers, BC's Top Employers, and Canada's Greenest Employers, the City of Vancouver seeks colleagues who can help shape and embody our core commitments to sustainability, decolonization, equity and outstanding quality of life for all residents.

Consider joining our committed team of staff and being part of an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.


Main Purpose and Function

The Security & Stage Door Attendant is responsible for providing a range of security, access control, customer service, first aid and safety functions at the Vancouver Civic Theatres (VCT) and its venues, The Queen Elizabeth Theatre, The Orpheum, The Vancouver Playhouse and the Orpheum Annex. The position responds to a variety of situations, both emergent and non-emergent in order to maintain a safe and secure environment.


This position reports to the Security and Operations Manager of Vancouver Civic Theatres (VCT), the position works as part of a team. Other contacts are VCT staff, clients, customers, performers and a variety of internal City departments such as Security and Facilities.


Specific Duties and Responsibilities

  • Monitors and grants access in a timely fashion to appropriate staff, contractors and licensees.
  • Monitors security cameras covering a variety of locations during events and during non-event times.
  • Performs foot patrols in designated locations on the VCT grounds and parking garage in order to maintain security.
  • Maintains records of keys, cards and other forms of access for staff, contractors, licensees and others to VCT facilities.
  • Investigates unusual events or incidents and writes up detailed incident reports in a timely fashion as a written record, and advises Coordinator of same.
  • Responds to emergent situations as a priority and calls for appropriate assistance which may include police, ambulance or fire.
  • Responds to facility emergencies such as fire and security alarms or breaches of them.
  • Receives and provides directions to visitors, staff, performers, stage crews and others entering the venue.
  • Coordinates pick-up and delivery of items at Stage Door with appropriate departments.
  • Receives and re-directs incoming mail for VCT.
  • Monitors and grants access in a timely fashion to appropriate staff, contractors and licensees.
  • Monitors security cameras covering a variety of locations during events and during non-event times.
  • Performs foot patrols in designated locations on the VCT grounds and parking garage in order to maintain security.
  • Maintains records of keys, cards and other forms of access for staff, contractors, licensees and others to VCT facilities.
  • Investigates unusual events or incidents and writes up detailed incident reports in a timely fashion as a written record, and advises Coordinator of same.
  • Responds to emergent situations as a priority and calls for appropriate assistance which may include police, ambulance or fire.
  • Responds to facility emergencies such as fire and security alarms or breaches of them.
  • Receives and provides directions to visitors, staff, performers, stage crews and others entering the venue.
  • Coordinates pick-up and delivery of items at Stage Door with appropriate departments.
  • Receives and re-directs incoming mail for VCT.
  • Follows established protocols for lock up and closure of the facility to ensure buildings are secure.
  • Other duties as assigned.

This position requires flexibility in scheduling as work is assigned and involves non-standard hours, including weekday, evening and weekend shifts.


Qualifications
Education and Experience:

  • Completion of Grade 10 (preferably Grade 12) with a minimum of one year experience as a Security Officer in a related area or an equivalent combination of training and experience.
  • Security Officer Training – BST as a minimum required
  • Occupational First Aid Level II required
  • Serving It Right certification is preferred

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite; booking or events software an asset.
  • Considerable knowledge of the procedures, practices and techniques related to security work, and providing access to venues.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced, complex and changing working environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to understand priority situations and attend to them in a timely fashion.
  • Strong interpersonal and verbal communication skills to deal effectively and tactfully with difficult or potentially volatile situations.
  • Good written communication skills and the ability to write reports as needed.
  • Ability to gain cooperation from others and to take effective measures in emergency situations.
  • Working knowledge of the buildings, grounds, parking areas etc. that will be patrolled and/or secured.
  • Ability to work effectively with minimal supervision, and as part of a larger team.
  • Physical ability to perform the duties of the position including walking long distances, up and down stairs under a variety of weather conditions.
  • Ability to remain calm, alert and high functioning under stressful conditions.
  • Demonstrated ability to use security industry relevant software programs.

Driver’s License and Record Checks:

  • A Police Record Check is a requirement of this position. A clearance requires the absence of any criminal charges or convictions related to this position.

All City of Vancouver employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire and ongoing employment. Candidates may only be exempted from this requirement if they request and are approved for an accommodation based on a reason related to a Human Rights Code ground (such as disability). Such a request must be made during, not after, the recruitment process.


Business Unit/Department: Arts, Culture and Community Services (1200)

Affiliation: CUPE 15 Non Pks

Employment Type: Auxiliary/Casual

Position Start Date: April 2021

Salary Information: Pay Grade GR-013: $24.88 to $29.13 per hour


Application Close: Open until filled

At the City of Vancouver, we are committed to recruiting a diverse workforce that represents the community we so proudly serve. Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, LGBT2Q+ and persons with disabilities are encouraged to apply. Accommodations will be provided upon request during the selection process. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion.


Before you click Apply now

Once you start your application you can save your work and leave the applications page, however please remember to submit your profile to the specific job requisition before the posting closing date.

In addition to uploading your cover letter and resume, part of the application process may include answering application questions related to the preferred requirements of the role which may take approx.. 5-10mins. Cover letters should express interest and highlight additional information relevant to the position and resumes should include a tailored summary of skills and experience related to the position.

title: Deputy Fire Chief - Operations
description:
The City of Yellowknife is an inclusive employer offering a dynamic and rewarding work environment that delivers valuable services to our residents. At the City, the diverse backgrounds of our employees help us to create a positive, safe and fun environment for us all. The City is committed to hiring a diverse and skilled workforce that is representative of the community, strengthening our ability to provide high quality services and excellent customer service to residents. In addition, the City of Yellowknife is committed to reconciliation and implementing actions intended to increase the number of Indigenous peoples who work for the City. The City of Yellowknife welcomes applications from all qualified candidates, and encourages Indigenous persons, visible minorities and persons with a disability to self-declare when submitting their application. We are currently actively recruiting for the position of Deputy Fire Chief - Operations. The Yellowknife Fire Division is a composite service that operates the City's dispatch, ambulance and fire services. It consists of one station, 32 full-time Fire Fighters/Paramedics, three Deputy Fire Chiefs, 1 Administrative staff and 7 dispatch staff.


Under the direction of the Fire Chief, the Deputy Fire Chief of Operations is responsible for the development and supervision of four duty crews, a dispatch service and maintenance and operations of all division property, apparatus and small equipment. This position must keep current with changing risks and hazards in the community and overall development and improvement of the fire and ambulance programs. At the scene of emergencies, the Deputy Fire Chief is responsible and accountable for the division's incident command system until relieved by another officer, if required. In the absence of the Fire Chief, the Deputy Fire Chief of Operations may be required to assume overall command of the division.


The skills and knowledge required to perform the duties of this position are normally obtained through secondary schooling, accreditation through a national fire training academy or technical school graduation andor five to ten years of progressively responsible emergency service experience.


Specific certifications that are required for this position include:

  • NFPA 1001 Level 2 (Fire Fighter)
  • NFPA 1002 (Apparatus Driver/Operator)
  • NFPA 1021 Level 3 (Fire Officer)
  • NFPA 1033 Fire Investigator Level 1
  • NFPA 1041 Level 2 (Fire Service Instructor)
  • Emergency Medical Technician - Ambulance/Primary Care Paramedic certification
  • Current CPR-C certification
  • NFPA 1521 Incident Safety Officer.

The City of Yellowknife offers a competitive salary range of $113,264 to $141,579 as well as a comprehensive benefits package including a monthly housing allowance, a defined benefit pension plan and relocation assistance. For further information or clarification of the job description, please contact Human Resources at: hr@yellowknife.ca.

Qualified applicants are required to apply no later than Monday, May 13, 2022.

Please visit the City of Yellowknife Website at: www.yellowknife.ca to submit your resume.


Please be advised that the City of Yellowknife requires all prospective employees to provide a criminal records check prior to employment. We thank all applicants who apply, but advise that only those to be interviewed will be contacted.

title: Patient Transfer Driver
description:
Patient Transfer Driver


We are seeking Drivers for our Patient Transfer Service to assist members of our communities transfer between medical facilities.


If you are looking for a career that you feel you could make a difference in, please read below!


Compensation Package:

A basic job, attracts basic pay – we believe that our crews should have the ability to increase their earnings if they wish - unlike many other employers, who ban / avoid higher paid overtime. Our compensation package includes hourly wage, an annual Bonus, the opportunity for overtime, and a Group Benefits and RRSP Program eligibility. There is a CPI pay review each year in January.

We are happy to show you the amounts our current crews ACTUALLY receive [ T4 Amount ] and the hours they spend on the job [anonymously of course].


Required:

  • Class 4 BC's Driver's License, with 5 years total driving experience
  • A Driver's Abstract with no more than 3 points
  • A current valid WSBC recognized First Aid qualification - Preferably OFA-III
  • Pass a Criminal Record Check to work with children and vulnerable adults
  • Vaccinations in accordance with the Immunization Policy for Health Care Workers
  • Both doses of the Covid vaccination

About Us:

We are the leading provider of non-emergency, patient transfers for medically stable patients throughout the Lower Mainland. Using our specially equipped fleet of Ambulances and Accessible vehicles, and ensuring they are transferred in a safe, compassionate and efficient manner.


Skills and Abilities:

  • Physically fit, ability to lift, push or pull 250+ lbs using a wheelchair, stretcher or stair chair with a partner.
  • Ability to effectively communicate - in English - verbally, non-verbally and in writing
  • A positive, can-do attitude, strong work ethic, and participation in what we do.
  • Demonstrated and relevant customer service experience, or experience working with patients.

What our patients / customers say about our crews :


  • Professional, courteous and really genuine people is all I have met during the 15 trips with this company over the last 2-1/2 months. ……. From the very first encounter with with Rob driving, and taking exceptional care of me & my wife......... I am so very impressed with the number of staff – Robin, Janet and so many others, who have been with you for many years. What shines through is that they really love what they are doing each day.”

All applicants will be required to complete a job application and participate in pre-employment testing.


We thank all those who apply, but only those selected for a prescreen interview will be contacted.

title: Emergency Response Crew Operator
description:
Emergency Response
Crew Operator
401/10, Ontario


Emcon Services Inc. is a proud Canadian based company with over 30 years of success as an interprovincial
Road and Bridge Maintenance Contractor. We currently have an opportunity for enthusiastic individuals to
join our team in the 401/10 area.

ü Are an experienced safety conscious ü You have highway maintenance
Operator? experience?

If you answered yes, we want you to join our team!

Reporting to the Patrol Supervisor, the Emergency Response Crew Operator is responsible for:

  • Carrying out safe emergency road closures under the direction of the Patrol Supervisor/Emergency Response
Lead Hands, when required to assist in the management of traffic operations in areas where accidents/incidents
have occurred;
  • Assisting Emergency Response Crew Lead Hands/Patrol staff in all emergency call/winter patrol assignments in
a manner that promotes cost effectiveness, staff co-operation and is perform all tasks in the safest manner
possible;
  • Providing support to other emergency services such as police, ambulances, firefighters, etc…when an
accident/incident has occurred with the highway division;
  • Ensuring documentation such as timesheets, work diaries, DI book, accident reports, spill reports, circle
checked, etc…are accurate and support other accident/incident data;
  • Providing assistance to maintenance crews with road closure setup and tear downs in accordance with Ontario
Traffic regulations/procedures;
  • Assisting in the maintenance and tracking of highway signs and vehicles, collecting roadside debris, and dead
animals in accordance with AMC contract specs, as well as repair and maintenance of the highway as required;
  • Other duties as assigned.

The successful candidate must have/be:
  • Minimum DZ license in good standing, AZ license considered an asset;
  • Experience in Provincial and or Municipal highway maintenance field;
  • Helpful, friendly and courteous with the public, regulatory agencies and peers;
  • Punctual and willing to work shift work;
  • Physically able to meet all requirements and perform satisfactorily all highway maintenance and emergency

assignments in a manner that promotes cost effective operations, staff co-operation and working in a safe and
environmentally friendly manner at all times.

This position is a unionized role with IUOE Local 793.

Emcon Services has the following conditions of employment: satisfactory drug pre-screening and Driver’s Abstract.
Qualified applicants are encouraged to forward their resume and covering letter to: careers@emconservices.ca

Emcon Services Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those
selected for interview will be contacted. Emcon Services Inc. will provide accommodation for individuals with

accessibility needs.

title: Mountain Bike Patroller
company: Sun Peaks Resort LLP/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel & Conference Centre
description:
Work, Live and Play

Sun Peaks Resort LLP has proven to be one of the highest levels of guest service providers within the ski industry. We can promise you a memorable and gainful working experience within our high volume and challenging work environments. Sun Peaks Resort LLP has many benefits to offer our employees including:

  • Full access Summer Alpine Hike and Downhill Bike season pass
  • Employee access to Golf Membership and discounted Golf Cart season pass
  • Employee Health and Wellness Program including EFAP services
  • Companywide discounts and benefit programs
  • Eligibility to participate in our Peak Performer Recognition Program, awarded at the end of our summer season at a specially planned event
  • Reciprocal riding at other participating BC and Alberta bike parks

Your Responsibilities will include:

  • Provide the highest possible standard of pre-hospital care for ill/injured guests in controlled recreational areas & golf courses as required
  • Provide and administer first aid to injured staff members of SPR LLP as required
  • Provide and perform rescue services for guests and employees as required, including but not limited to, low angle rope rescue, trail extrication, chairlift evacuation, patient transport, establishing helicopter landing zones
  • Work and communicate effectively with outside agencies such as BC Ambulance Service, RCMP, Sun Peaks Fire Rescue, KSAR
  • Carry out Patrol Investigations with a high level of efficiency and professionalism
  • Ensure proper trail and safety signage is appropriately placed and maintained according to industry and company standards
  • Daily checks of downhill mountain bike trails, while riding a downhill mountain bike in a safe and controlled manner at all times
  • Follow occupational health and safety regulations
  • Ongoing risk mitigation of bike trails and company premises
  • Maintain and complete documentation; including but not limited to first aid treatment paperwork, trail checks, equipment checks
  • Attend and engage in ongoing training throughout the season
  • Assist mountain bike trail crew with trail maintenance as required
  • Safe ATV operation/driving on mountain terrain
  • Adhere to company policies and Standard Operating Guidelines

Ideal Candidates:

  • Current 80+ hour first aid certificate or higher: I.e. OFA Level 3, Outdoor/Non-Urban Emergency Care, EMA EMR/PCP License (with OFA 3 endorsement preferred)
  • Strong Mountain Bike riding skills
  • High level of physical fitness and free of injury
  • Current PEAK Advanced Protocols certification preferred
  • Experience as either a winter ski patroller or summer bike patroller preferred
  • Basic understanding of Risk Management for Mountain Biking preferred
  • Valid BC Driver’s License Class 5 – Abstract required (Class 4 an asset)

Incentive Program:

If you are a student, currently enrolled in a college/university tourism and/or culinary/hospitality program, please note, that this role is eligible for fully reimbursed staff accommodation for the Summer season for successful applicants.

Please ensure you provide the required documentation and complete the information on your student status in the job application fields. (Conditions apply and will be discussed in detail with successful applicants during the interview and at the job offer stage).

If you have been referred by a current employee of Sun Peaks Resort/Sun Peaks Grand Hotel (or someone who has an accepted job offer for the Summer 2022 start), please ensure you indicate their name and current department in the required field in your application form.

title: Service Rig Personnel
description:
About us

Precision Well Servicing operates the largest fleet of service rigs in Canada, offering a wide range of products focused upon safety and quality.

Rewarding Oil and Gas careers are available!

Begin, or continue to build, your career with Precision Well Servicing!

We offer all our Field Team Employees the rewards of a stable income through our optional Stability+ Plan, as well as, progressive development and promotion through our mentorship and continuous training programs. All of the programs are designed to keep you safe at work, in control of your career, and offer financial stability to you and your family.

The Stability+ Plan offers our Field Team a continuous paycheque, 26 paycheques a year. Ask us about it!

We are currently seeking entry-level and experienced workers.

All of our team members are supported and mentored in the GROW program - seeking to provide you with the tools to be successful and safe in the field.

The Stability+ Plan offers:

  • Stability of Continuous Pay
  • Consistent and Guaranteed Pay Minimums
  • Continuous Benefit Coverage Without Interruption
  • Stable and Well Trained Crews

Precision is the largest Service Rig provider in Canada, with an impressive fleet of equipment and strong relationships with top-tier companies, all of which enable us to provide you with the rewarding career you are searching for. In addition, Precision also offers:

  • Immediate Placement
  • New PPE upon hire, including boots
  • Supportive team, from the field crew teams right to the Vice President and President of PWS, and all the levels in between.
  • Extended Health and Dental coverage, immediate coverage with experience*
  • Extensive and supportive on the job training - to set you up for success

Minimum Requirements

  • H2S Alive
  • Standard First Aid (Red Cross or St John Ambulance)
  • Class 5 Driver License, Air brakes preferred - GDL's are not permitted to operate commercial vehicles.
  • Common Safety Orientation (CSO) (Preferred)
  • Provide a 5-year commercial driver abstract
  • Previous experience in Oil Field related work and/or heavy general labor

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: From $28.00 per hour

Additional pay:

  • Overtime pay

Benefits:

  • Company pension
  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance

Schedule:

  • 10 hour shift
  • 12 hour shift
  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Experience:

  • oil and gas: 1 year (preferred)

Licence/Certification:

  • Driver's License (required)

Willingness to travel:

  • 50% (preferred)

title: Non-Emergency Patient Transfer Attendant
description:
Top Medical is always looking for caring, dedicated people to join our team of Medical Attendants. We are filling both full-time and part-time positions. Top Medical provides comfortable and caring non-urgent medical transportation for individuals who require an ambulance. This position entails working on a non-emergency ambulance vehicle as a member of a two person crew. Under the direction of the Top Medical Communications Centre, each crew is directed via two way radio to provide service to hospital patients and others who require transportation by stretcher on a non-emergency basis.

Our competent and compassionate team of certified attendants ensure patients receive a safe ride whether the trip is to or from a healthcare facility, nursing home, or private home; we want patients to receive the best care. We work together with healthcare providers, patients, and families to coordinate and provide convenient and professional services that are always in the best interests of all parties.

REQUIREMENTS

  • Valid Emergency Care/First Responder or Emergency Patient Care Certificate or valid AEMCA.
  • Valid ‘F’ Class Driving Licence (minimum G class, must be willing and able to upgrade)
  • Ability to provide outstanding customer service.
  • Must be able to work flexible hours including weekends, holidays and outside regular hours of operation – including on call shifts.
  • Ability to lift 250+ lbs using a stretcher or stair chair with a partner (Training Provided).
  • Possess a clean driving record and must have a current criminal record check.

Top Medical Transportation candidates must have a minimum certification of Emergency First Responder or Medical First Responder or currently be studying as a Paramedic and hold valid First Aid and CPR. Applicants must provide valid documentation.

Please fax your resume to (905) 695-9195 or email to topmedicaltransportation@yahoo.com (with cover letter) titled: Attention: Recruiting – Medical Attendants.

We look forward to hearing from you.
For more information contact us by phone:

416 716 6167

title: RPN - Medical Operations Team Lead (Adminstration & Purchasing)
description:
MEDICAL OPERATIONS TEAM LEAD


The Medical Team Lead will support the Medical Operations department with a variety of hands on and administrative duties. This role will require administrative skills in the areas of data entry, word processing, spreadsheet preparation and maintenance, as well as all aspects of inventory control and procurement for the department.


This role will also require hands-on work with a variety of medical equipment and medications; maintaining and ordering of inventories and supply lists, tracking medication expiries, troubleshooting of equipment, and arranging for repairs and maintenance as needed for medical equipment.


This role will not involve working directly with patients/clients. It will involve lots of hands on with equipment and inventory as well as the administrative duties.


Duties & Responsibilities:


  • Inventory procurement of all medical supplies and equipment.
  • Sourcing new suppliers or supplies based on discontinuation or new projects, negotiate, prepare contracts/agreements.
  • Maintenance and/or preparation of excel files for inventory, monthly, and year end.
  • Monthly, update files for expirations of medical bag supplies, medications, and replacement of these items (hands-on).
  • Placing /receiving orders, creating POs, communicating with suppliers, track orders/back orders, update the purchasing database, approve invoices for payment.
  • Stocking/restocking of stock expired items. Labelling, organizing, and counting.
  • Preventative maintenance of medical equipment, shipping/receiving of equipment as required.
  • Trouble shooting of equipment problems if necessary.
  • Preparing and maintaining/updating KPI’s, QA issues, and medical data base reports.
  • Communication with medical crews regarding issues, suggestions, feedback, pre/peri/post missions.
  • Follow up with, and documentation of, post mission findings, and stock/restock utilization.
  • Train Med staff on various new or updated supplies, procedures, forms, electronics, equipment.
  • Ordering of commissary items for crews/med ops.
  • Scheduling – gathering of availability for FNC’s
  • IT related tasks: upload manuals, update templates, clean laptop accounts of the previous missions related documents and photos, iPhone apps, labeling, train Med Staff on how to use electronics

Additional Duties:


Work in conjunction with the Medical Administrator, you will at times share in the following responsibilities:


  • Assistance with preparation of training sessions, booking of rooms, attendance for training and company gatherings, etc.
  • Format and spell checking of Insurance Letters for Finance
  • General filing and computer tasks
  • Mailing of promotional packs
  • Preparation and ordering of chart packages
  • Scanning, photocopying as needed
  • Assist with Conducting COVID Swabs/Screening of staff and/or paperwork required.
  • Prepare/monitor crews’ checklists for completion
  • Laundry
  • Temperature monitoring
  • Restock of medical kits and aircraft
  • Support Medical Ops Manager and Medical Admin with other tasks related to operations as assigned
  • Ad hoc duties as needed

Qualifications


  • Post Secondary Education as a Healthcare Practitioner (i.e., Paramedic, RPN, Lab Tech, PTA/OTA, Medical Assistant etc.) or Medical Office Administration
  • Knowledge of Medical equipment (Zoll, Ventilators, Infusion Pumps), preferred
  • Medical terminology, knowledge of medical supplies, & medications is an asset
  • 2-3 years experience working in an administrative and/or medical capacity
  • MUST be computer savvy with solid computer skills and experience; MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Access), especially Excel, Word, and Outlook
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
  • Positive attitude and excellent customer service skills
  • Good attendance and punctuality record
  • Ability to work as a team and in independent situations
  • Motivated with the ability to seek out new opportunities to help the department
  • Problem solving and multitasking abilities
  • Has own reliable transportation
  • Willing to be flexible occasionally to start early or stay later if required for operations

  • Preference will be given to candidates who have ‘hands on’ Healthcare experience working with medical supplies and equipment.

What's in it for you?


  • Permanent position with the potential to grow with the organization
  • Full Medical & Dental Benefits after probation
  • Group RRSP with company match after first year of service
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program
  • Corporate Phone Plans
  • Catered lunches on the last Friday of every month
  • Team Events; Christmas Party, Summer BBQ's etc.
  • Competitive Salary

Latitude Air Ambulance is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability, and conviction for an offence for which a pardon has been granted or in respect of which a record suspension has been ordered. or any other protected characteristic as outlined by the Canada Human Rights Act.


This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Latitude Air Ambulance makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.


Latitude Air Ambulance welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a disability related accommodation during the application process under the Accessible Canada Act, please reach out to hr@latitude2009.com.
