title: RPN - Medical Operations Team Lead (Adminstration & Purchasing)
description:
MEDICAL OPERATIONS TEAM LEAD


The Medical Team Lead will support the Medical Operations department with a variety of hands on and administrative duties. This role will require administrative skills in the areas of data entry, word processing, spreadsheet preparation and maintenance, as well as all aspects of inventory control and procurement for the department.


This role will also require hands-on work with a variety of medical equipment and medications; maintaining and ordering of inventories and supply lists, tracking medication expiries, troubleshooting of equipment, and arranging for repairs and maintenance as needed for medical equipment.


This role will not involve working directly with patients/clients. It will involve lots of hands on with equipment and inventory as well as the administrative duties.


Duties & Responsibilities:


  • Inventory procurement of all medical supplies and equipment.
  • Sourcing new suppliers or supplies based on discontinuation or new projects, negotiate, prepare contracts/agreements.
  • Maintenance and/or preparation of excel files for inventory, monthly, and year end.
  • Monthly, update files for expirations of medical bag supplies, medications, and replacement of these items (hands-on).
  • Placing /receiving orders, creating POs, communicating with suppliers, track orders/back orders, update the purchasing database, approve invoices for payment.
  • Stocking/restocking of stock expired items. Labelling, organizing, and counting.
  • Preventative maintenance of medical equipment, shipping/receiving of equipment as required.
  • Trouble shooting of equipment problems if necessary.
  • Preparing and maintaining/updating KPI’s, QA issues, and medical data base reports.
  • Communication with medical crews regarding issues, suggestions, feedback, pre/peri/post missions.
  • Follow up with, and documentation of, post mission findings, and stock/restock utilization.
  • Train Med staff on various new or updated supplies, procedures, forms, electronics, equipment.
  • Ordering of commissary items for crews/med ops.
  • Scheduling – gathering of availability for FNC’s
  • IT related tasks: upload manuals, update templates, clean laptop accounts of the previous missions related documents and photos, iPhone apps, labeling, train Med Staff on how to use electronics

Additional Duties:


Work in conjunction with the Medical Administrator, you will at times share in the following responsibilities:


  • Assistance with preparation of training sessions, booking of rooms, attendance for training and company gatherings, etc.
  • Format and spell checking of Insurance Letters for Finance
  • General filing and computer tasks
  • Mailing of promotional packs
  • Preparation and ordering of chart packages
  • Scanning, photocopying as needed
  • Assist with Conducting COVID Swabs/Screening of staff and/or paperwork required.
  • Prepare/monitor crews’ checklists for completion
  • Laundry
  • Temperature monitoring
  • Restock of medical kits and aircraft
  • Support Medical Ops Manager and Medical Admin with other tasks related to operations as assigned
  • Ad hoc duties as needed

Qualifications


  • Post Secondary Education as a Healthcare Practitioner (i.e., Paramedic, RPN, Lab Tech, PTA/OTA, Medical Assistant etc.) or Medical Office Administration
  • Knowledge of Medical equipment (Zoll, Ventilators, Infusion Pumps), preferred
  • Medical terminology, knowledge of medical supplies, & medications is an asset
  • 2-3 years experience working in an administrative and/or medical capacity
  • MUST be computer savvy with solid computer skills and experience; MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Power Point, Outlook, Access), especially Excel, Word, and Outlook
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
  • Positive attitude and excellent customer service skills
  • Good attendance and punctuality record
  • Ability to work as a team and in independent situations
  • Motivated with the ability to seek out new opportunities to help the department
  • Problem solving and multitasking abilities
  • Has own reliable transportation
  • Willing to be flexible occasionally to start early or stay later if required for operations

  • Preference will be given to candidates who have ‘hands on’ Healthcare experience working with medical supplies and equipment.

What's in it for you?


  • Permanent position with the potential to grow with the organization
  • Full Medical & Dental Benefits after probation
  • Group RRSP with company match after first year of service
  • Access to an Employee Assistance Program
  • Corporate Phone Plans
  • Catered lunches on the last Friday of every month
  • Team Events; Christmas Party, Summer BBQ's etc.
  • Competitive Salary

Latitude Air Ambulance is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability, and conviction for an offence for which a pardon has been granted or in respect of which a record suspension has been ordered. or any other protected characteristic as outlined by the Canada Human Rights Act.


This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. Latitude Air Ambulance makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.


Latitude Air Ambulance welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If you require a disability related accommodation during the application process under the Accessible Canada Act, please reach out to hr@latitude2009.com.

title: Racing Surfaces Engineer
description:
Our rich history is a big part of who we are. With historic roots dating back over 135 years, Woodbine is steeped in tradition. We have been the engine that drives the Ontario horse racing industry. From King’s and Queen’s trips to Canada, anniversaries and unforgettable horse races, we have been creating winning experiences for all our guests.

We are currently on an amazing 20-year journey to ‘build a city within a city’ and transform the largest privately held land in Toronto into one of Canada’s premiere entertainment destinations. This journey will unlock the value of approximately 700 acres of land, leading to job creation and the revitalization of our communities, while enhancing our ability to share the thrill of horse-racing and cementing our place as an entertainment powerhouse.
We need dedicated people to join our cause. Be part of Woodbine Entertainment and get inspired to make work awesome!

Our Values & Beliefs
| WOW EVERY GUEST | OWN IT! | LISTEN & CONNECT – PEOPLE MATTER | FUEL THE FUN & PASS IT ON | TRUST IN OUR TEAM | #WE CARE | PURSUE YOUR POTENTIAL |BE BOLD| BE ALL IN |

Department: Racing
Reports To: Senior Vice President, Standardbred & Thoroughbred Racing
Business Address: 555 Rexdale Boulevard, Toronto, ON, M9W5L2
Language of Work: English
Type of Employment: Full-time
Salary Range: $110,000 to $160,000 per annum based on 40 hours per week
Benefits: Health, Dental, Vision, Defined Contribution Pension Plan, Paid Vacation, Life Insurance, Short-term and Long-term Disability
Contact Information:
Email: msebastiao@woodbine.com
Telephone: 416-675-3993 ext. 3254
Mailing Address: Same as business address

JOB SUMMARY
The purpose of this position is to lead the Racing surfaces division for an effective and efficient maintenance of thoroughbred horseracing and training surfaces at Woodbine Racetrack. This includes direct responsibility for the overall management and day to day supervision of the racing surfaces maintenance staff, which includes unionized and non- unionized employees. Responsibilities will also include complete oversight of racing surfaces. This position will be responsible for the redevelopment of the horseracing and training track infrastructure related to the master plan for the Woodbine property.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
1. Develop, manage and lead an effective Thoroughbred Racing Surfaces team to ensure the safety of all racing participants (equine and human), across all five racing surfaces at Woodbine Racetrack (racing turf and Tapeta courses, training dirt and turf courses). Support Woodbine’s position as leader in racetrack safety in North America by developing and executing racing surface operating plans that support Woodbine’s overall thoroughbred racing strategy.
2. Conduct and analyze soil samplings, penetrometer readings, doing stick readings to ensure optimal track performance and maintenance and communications with horse people and race office.
3. Develop and implement irrigation programs and fertilizing programs for new and mature turf racing surface.
4. Provide leadership, direction and ongoing learning opportunities to Woodbine thoroughbred track maintenance staff. Manage, assess, and monitor overall staff performance and identify areas for improvement, development, and additional training.
5. Manage the maintenance of all five thoroughbred tracks at Woodbine (racing and training), ensuring safety and compliance and readiness for racing and training. Make informed recommendations, by leveraging both quantitative and qualitative information, to the SVP, Racing on whether racing should be cancelled and provide back up and insight on the issue at hand in terms of track condition and safety.
6. Manage the capital requirement for heavy equipment– make recommendations to the Vice President, Operations Woodbine and SVP Racing on equipment and asset acquisitions to ensure world class racing and training surfaces are maintained for thoroughbred horse racing.
7. Manage the Thoroughbred Racing Surfaces staffing budget, financial reports, and goals/objectives with direction from the SVP, Racing.
8. Develop relevant business investment cases for the procurement of new equipment. Ensure business case development is factual with relevant metrics and ties to Woodbine’s overall thoroughbred racing strategy.
9. Develop and implement new tools and work procedures aimed at maximizing effectiveness and efficiency of the thoroughbred horse racing surfaces (training and racing) at Woodbine Racetrack while ensuring safety of all racing surfaces is a top priority.
10. Manage daily Track Log processes on all Woodbine track surfaces, with qualitative and quantitative information, ensuring accuracy and completeness of the data points collected.
11. Provide Track Log information to the Government Regulator, AGCO, and liaise on safety practices and any required investigations.
12. Liaise with the Director, Facilities & Property Services on storm water management and environmental requirements that impact thoroughbred racing surfaces. In addition, partner with the Manager, Fleet Operations to ensure operating equipment is in good working order and maintenance procedures are documented and performed as required.
13. Responsible for the assessment of operational staffing to efficiently and effectively meet the operational demands of all racing and training surfaces on a day to day basis. Make recommendations to on required staffing levels.
14. Consultation and implementation with Property Development team on the future state of training track surfaces at Woodbine, and project management of the rebuild of racing infrastructure and training facilities related to track surfaces.
15. Ensure all track surfaces equipment is in safe working condition and ensure staff are properly trained.
16. Manage the turf rail and fertilizer schedules for both the E.P. Taylor Turf Course as well as the Inner Turf Course in addition to the integrated Pest Management Program in collaboration with the Property Services department and Thoroughbred Race Office.
17. Ensure Horse Ambulance, Starting Gate & track lights are operational and in good working order for live racing.
18. Develop and maintain positive relationships with horse-people and other racing related personnel and stakeholders (Horsepeople’s Associations, Jockeys of Canada Guild).
19. Interpret, administer and implement the applicable Collective Agreement, organizational policies and Human Resource policies.
20. Exhibit and demonstrate and encourage Woodbine’s core values and beliefs. Trust in the Team, Be All In, Pursue Your Potential, Fuel the Fun, Be Bold,

JOB SPECIFICATIONS
Knowledge
  • Expert knowledge of track surfaces (soils, turf, irrigation, weather systems) and related issues and machinery
  • Expert knowledge of horses and the horse racing industry
  • General to advanced understanding of the operational and regulatory structure of horse racing
  • General knowledge of union contracts and employment regulations and human relations

Skills
  • Advanced interpersonal, communication, leadership, organization and management skills
  • Must be flexible and innovative
  • Ability to multi-task in a fast paced and ever-changing environment
  • Ability to make sound decisions on non-routine issues while considering multiple variables and outcomes
  • Proficient with computer (Word, Excel)
  • Experience with weather tracking software
Education and Experience
  • Post-secondary degree in Agricultural Engineering or similar Engineering discipline
  • Advanced training and education in the area of horticulture, grounds, and plant physiology, water engineering- irrigation water systems, soil conditions
  • Requirement to be licensed by the Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario (AGCO)
  • 5 years’ experience managing grounds and maintenance staff in the horse-racing industry
  • Experience with the professional maintenance of turf (grass) and dirt surfaces for horse racing competition purposes
  • Experience managing a crew operating heavy equipment around active race horses
Guided by our Values and Beliefs, Woodbine Entertainment commits to providing an authentic and empowering work experience! Please reach out if you're ready to embrace change and be part of a new breed of experience while working for one of Canada’s certified Great Places to Work!

title: Captain – Air Ambulance
description:
PAL Aerospace is driven by technology and is proud to be a pioneer of industry-leading innovations in airborne special missions. PAL Aerospace has been a leader in the design and operation of air ambulance/medevac aircraft in Eastern Canada. The company has extensive experience providing medevac services to provincial health departments in Atlantic Canada. With offices and divisions of PAL at home and abroad, opportunity within PAL is everywhere. Whether you want to pursue new education, move to another country, or enjoy the awesome benefits that come with being an employee, you can make that happen at PAL.

PAL Aerospace is currently looking for a Captain – King Air 200 to join the Air Ambulance team in Halifax, NS. The Air Ambulance operation provides fixed wing service to the EHS LifeFlight program servicing Nova Scotia, Prince Edward Island and New Brunswick for critical care air medical transport. We fly a uniquely modified King Air 200 that was specifically designed to meet the requirements of the LifeFlight Air Ambulance program and is the only one of its design.

Position Overview:

The service PAL Aerospace provides to LifeFlight requires the applicant to thrive in a team environment and adapt to mission-based flying. All program pilots and Air Medical crew are stationed at the LifeFlight base together for 12-hour shift rotations around the clock. The pilot schedule is based on a 4 shift on 4 off rotation, each shift rotation will consist of 4 days or 4 nights consecutive followed by four days off. The aircraft is dispatched on a 20-minute readiness to fly upon request for a mission.

Qualifications:

  • 3500 hours Total Time
  • 1000 hours on type or similar turbine preferred
  • 1000 hours PIC
  • Pilot license (ATPL)
  • Demonstrated analytical and decision-making skills
  • Demonstrated teamwork and interpersonal skills

PAL Aerospace is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Registered ACP-Paramedic
description:
Your Opportunity:

Description:

As a Paramedic, you will assess emergency scenes and patients and may transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation. You will treat patients by administering medications, advanced life support (ALS) airway adjuncts and electrical therapy. You may also lead the ALS crew in delivering clinical care during patient transport or at emergency scenes. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped. Alberta Health Services EMS requires the proof of the successful completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test via the certificate provided by the Lifemark organization for all applicants external to AHS or internal to AHS, who do not already hold a clinical position within AHS EMS (VESST, Clinical Educator, EMR, PCP, ACP and Community Paramedic). Your F.A.R.E. test must be completed six (6) prior to the date of your application. Alberta Health Services EMS may verify results with Lifemark to ensure the candidate has successfully completed the test. Please contact Lifemark at www.lifemark.ca/alberta-health-services to find more information on the F.A.R.E. test and how to book your evaluation.

description:

As an Emergency Medical Technician, you will transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. title: Flight Paramedic (ACP) / Flight Nurse (RN) - Aeromedical Attendant
description:
SkyNorth Air Ambulance is accepting applications for Full time Flight Paramedics (ACP) and Flight Nurses (RN).

Aero-A is the title used in Manitoba as either Advanced Care Paramedics or qualified Registered Nurses working as an Aeromedical Attendant for Air Ambulance.

Aero-A Requirements:

  • Paramedics must have graduated from a recognized Advance Care Paramedic (ACP) program and be practicing as an ACP.
  • Paramedics must be current with the College of Paramedics of Manitoba.
  • Nurses must have graduated from a recognized critical care / emergency course or have two years of related experience.
  • Nurses must be current with the College of Registered Nurses of Manitoba.
  • Candidates must be certified in BLS, ACLS and one of the following trauma courses - TNCC, PHTLS or ITLS.
  • Manitoba Child abuse Registry clearance (max 60 days old).
  • Criminal Record Check with vulnerable person clearance (max 60 days old)
  • All Aeromedical Attendants must complete a CAMATA course or equivalent within a reasonable time frame (paid for by SkyNorth Air).

.

SkyNorth Air Requirements

  • Proven ability to perform effectively in both a team environment and independently.
  • Must have strong decision making skills and able to adapt well to a changing environment.
  • Position involves staying at one of our three bases (Island Lake, Thompson or Winnipeg) while awaiting dispatch. Crews consist of two pilots and one AMS.
  • Two years of practicing as an ACP or ER experience is preferred.
  • Crew quarters are comfortable with a minimum of three bedrooms, kitchen, full bathroom, satellite TV and high speed internet.
  • Job orientation will be provided and the duration will be based on individual comfort zone.
  • Full time schedule is a Tuesday – Tuesday one week -or- two week rotation
  • Proof of Covid-19 Vaccination Required for Employment

.

SkyNorth Air offers competitive guaranteed wages and a mileage based incentive plan. We also offer retention bonuses as well as a flight credit for out of province paramedics and nurses that commute. Optional Manulife benefits package (after 6 months) and RRSP/DPSP plans are available.

.

Only qualified Paramedics (ACP) and Nurses (RN) will be contacted for an interview. SkyNorth Air suggests reading the requirements carefully before applying. Uniforms are provided and required courses are paid for by SkyNorth Air after date of hire.

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Extended health care
  • Life insurance
  • RRSP match

Experience:

  • ACP or RN: 2 years (preferred)

title: Registered EMT - Paramedic
description:
Your Opportunity:

Our team provides exemplary emergency room care for patients in a collaborative, interdisciplinary team environment. As a Registered EMT - Paramedic, you will play an important role in supporting and integrated and holistic approach to patient care, health promotion and maintenance. You will contribute your nursing assessment, interpersonal and written documentation skills to assist with the treatment of trauma-associated injury. You will provide safe, quality patient and family centered care while reflecting the shared vision and values of AHS. You will enjoy working at our new Regional Hospital and Cancer Centre scheduled to open this fall. The city of Grande Prairie has something for everyone. We are a growing city with close to 70,000 residents and serving approximately 260,000 people in the surrounding area. In addition to a state of the art recreation facility, there are numerous parks and golf courses, and a vibrant arts and culture community. If you are reliable, motivated, and thrive in a dynamic environment, come join our team! In addition to a competitive rate of pay, AHS currently has a Remote Retention Allowance in place to an annual maximum of $3,000. This allowance is non-pensionable and is payable on an hourly basis for all hours paid at the basic rate of pay.

Description:

As a Paramedic, you will assess emergency scenes and patients and may transport ill or injured patients from scenes of emergency and/or between facilities. This includes operating ambulances or other modes of transportation. You will treat patients by administering medications, advanced life support (ALS) airway adjuncts and electrical therapy. You may also lead the ALS crew in delivering clinical care during patient transport or at emergency scenes. You will assist with ensuring that ambulances or other Emergency Medical Services (EMS) vehicles, such as transfer vans, are properly stocked and equipped.

  • Classification: Registered EMT - Paramedic
  • Union: HSAA Facility PROF/TECH
  • Department: General Emergency
  • Primary Location: Grande Prairie Rgnl Hospital
  • Multi-Site: Not Applicable
  • FTE: 0.75
  • Posting End Date: 13-MAY-2022
  • Employee Class: Regular Part Time
  • Date Available: 23-MAY-2022
  • Hours per Shift: 11.25
  • Length of Shift in weeks: 42
  • Shifts per cycle: 32
  • Shift Pattern: Days, Nights, Weekends
  • Days Off: As Per Rotation
  • Minimum Salary: $33.99
  • Maximum Salary: $44.75
  • Vehicle Requirement: Not Applicable
Required Qualifications:

Completion of an accredited Advanced Care Paramedic program. Active registration with Alberta College of Paramedics (ACP) as an Advanced Care Paramedic. Current Basic Cardiac Life Support - Healthcare Provider (BCLS-HCP). Must hold a valid Class 4 Alberta Operator's Licence with no more than six (6) demerits. Completion of the Functional Abilities Recruitment Evaluation (F.A.R.E.) test taken no more than six (6) months prior to the application date.

Additional Required Qualifications:

As required.

Preferred Qualifications:

ACLS, TNCC, PALS, NRP preferred.

title: Advanced Care Paramedic
description:
Advanced Care Paramedic (ACP)
Flight Division
Full-Time – High Level/Fort Vermilion, AB Competition number 050222-140
With 21 years of experience in Emergency Medical Services across Alberta, Advanced Paramedic Ltd. provides exciting opportunities in many facets of the industry, including Air Ambulance, Ground Ambulance, Industrial, Remote Northern Clinics, Special Events, Medical Standby, and Non-Emergent Medical Transport! This diversity provides the perfect platform to jumpstart your career! For more information about APL, refer to our website at: www.advancedparamedic.com
Why work for APL?

  • We offer a competitive group benefits program including:
  • Extended Health & Dental
  • Health & Wellness Spending accounts
  • RRSP Matching
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Employee referral bonuses
  • Flexible schedule
  • Practice using the latest industry technology
  • Because people matter…and we want the opportunity to show you what that means to us

Position Information:

  • Minimum starting rate of $525.00 per day
  • Scheduling: 2 weeks on, 2 weeks off
  • $600 Weekly Travel Incentive
  • $17 Daily Meal Allowance
  • $75 Daily Retention Bonus

  • Valid Class 4 driver’s license & a 3-year history driver’s abstract
  • Valid BLS, ACLS & PALS Certification

  • Current immunization record that includes COVID 19 or applicable exemption(s)

Please submit a cover letter and resume to Human Resources, quoting competition number 050222-140. This posting will remain open until a suitable candidate has been found.
If you have previously applied to APL, please re-apply with the appropriate competition number.
We thank all applicants for their interest in the position, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted

  • Bonus pay

Benefits:

  • Dental care
  • Employee assistance program
  • Extended health care
  • Flexible schedule
  • RRSP match

Licence/Certification:

  • Registration for an Alberta College of Paramedics (required)
  • Valid Class 4 (required)
  • Valid BLS (required)
  • Valid ACLS (required)
  • Valid PALS (required)

title: Flight Nurse RN Class A
description:
Competition 2022001, Permanent Full Time Position, Moncton



Permanent Full Time Position

Moncton


Ambulance New Brunswick (ANB) provides land and air ambulance services in New Brunswick.

We are currently searching for a highly motivated and qualified registered nurse to staff a permanent full time position as a Flight Nurse with the provincial air ambulance service.

Flight nursing is a challenging specialty performed in a unique out-of-hospital environment. It is a distinctive and expanded role for a registered nurse that encompasses the air medical transport of critically ill and injured pediatric (greater than 28 days corrected) and adult patients.

The flight nurse practices autonomously within the scope of practice, policies, procedures and guidelines defined by ANB, and in accordance with the Nurses Association of New Brunswick’s regulations and standards. The flight nurse also practices collaboratively with members of the air medical crew, medical control physicians, paramedics, communications specialists, pilots and other personnel.


As the ideal candidate for this position, you:

  • are currently registered or are eligible to be registered as a Registered Nurse (RN) in the province of New Brunswick;
  • possess a minimum 3 years’ experience caring for critically ill or injured patients; or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience;
  • hold current certifications in BCLS, ACLS and PALS;
  • possess previous experience in flight nursing or transport nursing duties (an asset);
  • are willing to obtain certification in PHTLS/TNCC (or equivalent) within six months of employment;
  • are able to successfully complete required flight training, including but not limited to: flight physiology, flight safety, and land and sea survival training;
  • are able to successfully complete training for performance of required post entry-level competencies;
  • must be willing to work rotating 12 hour shifts; start time 0730 and 1930 respectively, 1.0 FTE.
  • possess the ability to function within and work efficiently as a member of a multidisciplinary team.

Written & Spoken competence in English or French is required. Submit your application: hr-rh@ambulancenb.ca.

You will receive an automatic e-mail confirmation upon successful receipt of your application. No phone calls please.

We would like to thank all candidates for expressing interest. Please note only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

Any candidate not currently employed in the New Brunswick Public Service will need to provide proof of full vaccination against COVID-19, or a valid medical certificate exempting them from the vaccine.

Ambulance New Brunswick is committed to the principle of equal opportunity in its employment practices and to providing an environment free from discrimination and harassment for all employees is an equal opportunity employer.
